Reviews.Title: “Lovely little boutique hotel in the Pike Place Market”
Reviews.Author: LolaWantsandGets
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a recent business trip for 4 nights. The hotel is quick and scenic walk from the Bell Harbor Conference Center. The service was impeccable - everyone on the hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. I was also able to check-in early, which I greatly appreciated since I arrived in Seattle in the early afternoon. The city view room I had was spacious and clean, the lighting was bright and sufficient for a woman doing makeup and hair -- although one of the main lights over the mirror died during my stay and housekeeping didn't notice/fix it. I also liked the high-end toiletries that were available. The turn-down service with Seattle chocolates was a nice touch. The king size bed I had was super comfy. The only gripe I have with the whole hotel (really!) is with the pillows: they are feather and way too soft. No neck or head support whatsoever. Luckily, I asked if they had any others and was provided with memory-foam pillows right away! This is especially awesome for me since this is what I have at home. Room service was amazing, since it is provided by one of the great restaurants down below the hotel -- either Champagne or Marché -- and it is brought up quickly. Not a lot of waiting for your food, which was very nice. I was fortunate enough to get sunny weather while in Seattle so I was actually able to enjoy the hotel's rooftop deck and its spectacular views of Puget Sound for a bit. Last but not least, the location of the Inn at the Market is fantastic. You are right smack dab in the middle of the famous Pike Place Market, which has so many great restaurants, shops, bakeries, coffee shops (and the very first Starbucks too), parks and green space... just a fabulous place to hang out and explore. I can't wait to return to Seattle and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best find!”
Reviews.Author: Reflection2
Reviews.Content: Inn at the market is the best place to stay when visiting downtown Seattle. They rooms are nicely appointed, clean, and comfortable. The location is perfect to walk to all of the nearby points of interest. The staff is very professional, thoughtful, and and seem to be happy. Of course the view from the room is unbeatable! A Jewell in the emerald city.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: c r
Reviews.Content: The Inn at the Market has to be the best place to stay in downtown Seattle. You can park and never drive again because so many attractions and stores are within walking distance. The staff is incredibly nice and helpful. We had to retrieve things from our vehicle that we forgot and the valet would get them out of the car and deliver them to our room. On checkout we shopped at Pike St Market purchasing several items they took to the car and brought it downstairs so we could shop more and leave the car until 5pm. This is the best hotel I've stayed at in a long time. There is a lockable safe in the room and they also have lockers in the lobby to store your items if you want to spend the day in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Slept Well in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Donna P
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Seattle started as a 3 hour nightmare stuck in traffic. I ended up getting lost and the hotel staff helped me get back on track. I was stressed to the max when I got there but the friendly and professional folks at the Inn quickly put me at ease. They had me at hello but it just kept getting better. The desk clerk quickly got me a reservation at Etta's, which was great for dinner. I had an upgraded room with a huge window and the full panorama of Puget sound. And the pillows! I swooned at their softness and the European-style duvet was just so lovely and welcoming. The bathroom was spacious and clean. The breakfast delivered to my room was a perfect omelette, nice and light, with true homestyle roasted potatoes and bakery bread. A chai latte and tall glass of carrot juice sealed the deal. Can you tell I liked this place? The Inn opens to a lovely little courtyard and is steps from all the best that Pike's Place has to offer. I travel a lot for business and Inn at the Market is now one of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Simply AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: vegasERdoc
Reviews.Content: From day 1, the staff of The Inn did everything possible to make our stay absolutely amazing. From Noel in management, to our driver Nook, we were constantly amazed at the little details that EVERY member of the staff included in making our weekend the most romantic possible. We will NEVER stay anywhere else when visiting Seattle. Thanks again, and sorry that our January trip is being mentioned this late in the year. Warmest regards to Noel and the staff!!! ~Alex

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ths118
Reviews.Content: Growing up in Seattle, I had always seen the entrance to this hotel but never stayed here. For a recent special occasion (birthday) we had a mini stay-cation and had the pleasure of staying at this lovely hotel. The staff is welcoming and kind - and even surprised us with a complimentary bottle of wine to celebrate the birthday. What a thoughtful touch that meant a lot to us and was just the icing on the cake for an overall wonderful experience. The rooms are surprisingly generously sized - The hotel in significantly larger than it looks on the outside. The 'rooftop' deck is spacious as well, i only wish the weather had been better the weekend we stayed so we could've enjoyed it for longer than a quick run in the rain for a picture with the Pike Place Market sign in the background. And the location.... so many great activities at the doorstep of The Inn at the Market. Highlighted definitely include: Can Can for a show, Alibi room for late night pizza pig out, and morning after brunch at Seatown. I'm ready for another stay-cation just thinking about it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: mamamia46
Reviews.Content: Welcomed with excellent valet service, friendly and efficient check-in service and pleasantly surprised to find we were upgraded to a waterfront room with fabulous views and a great bed (thank you so much!). The suite was large, airy and elegant. Bathroom ditto. We had dinner at the Cafe Campagne and grabbed a quick breakfast at the Crumpet Place - one of my favourite stops in Seattle. Don't know if a room with street-view would be as quiet as those with waterfront view, but we loved our restful sleep with the window open to let the seabreeze in.

Reviews.Title: “Magic, simply magic.”
Reviews.Author: tholstra
Reviews.Content: a lovely hotel, amazing service, and views and abundance of fantastic restaurants and activities within short walking distance. On a very steep hill so wear flats or other walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Seattle hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ksdee1
Reviews.Content: We were blown away by this little hotel! You could not ask for a more perfect location. It is literally across the street from Pike's Market and the views are to die for. Our water view room had a gorgeous view of the Olympic mountains, the ferries and sailboats, and Bainbridge Island. The roof deck is the perfect spot to enjoy a cup of coffe or a glass of wine. You couldn't ask for better service. The bell staff, the front desk staff and the cleaning staff were top notch! A wonderful place to stay and enjoy all Seattle has to offer,

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get back”
Reviews.Author: DagFH
Reviews.Content: We are back in Sweden after our visits to Vancouver (BC), Victoria (BC) and Seattle. In Seattle we stayed at Inn at the Market, 3 nights during March 5th -8th, 2012. This hotel was undoubtedly the best of the three hotels we stayed in during our travel (even though all of them are very good), which very much was due to the very personal and kind service - and to our great room with the fantastic view! We appreciated very much the welcoming and warm atmosphere at the hotel. All the staff we met was very friendly. Especially the front desk staff was the best we met for a very long time! They were so friendly, so helpful and so attentive in a very sympathetic way. Even the room attendants and the “bellboys” were all very nice and outgoing! We had room no. 704, and enjoyed the fantastic view from the room every morning and every evening. We very lucky enough to have marvelous sunsets during our stay - and therefore great photo memories as well :-) Of course, we even enjoyed the room itself a lot, as the luxury & comfortable bed as well as the large & well equipped bathroom. The address of the hotel is the very best in Seattle; it is next to everything....and especially next to the fascinating and exciting Pike Place Market, and with a fantastic sea- and mountain view. We will love to come back to Seattle during the summer season. The city has so much to offer. The nature is very beautiful….as it even is in Vancouver and Victoria. The city is a great place to enjoy ahead of starting a cruise to Alaska, which we would love to do the next time. We will gladly recommend the Inn at the Market to everybody. And we can’t wait – we want to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Like everyone else”
Reviews.Author: nanstevens
Reviews.Content: I checked with TripAdvisor before booking at the Inn at the Market. Like everyone else, I loved it. The valet/bell boys were very nice. You drive up to a little spot in front of a little sign and the bell boys quickly did everything perfectly including holding baggage after I checked out. Parking otherwise is quite a pain. I enjoyed the deck on top. I decided not to pay extra for a view room. I figured I'd look at the street and that would be fine. Be sure you don't get room #404. It is a lovely room but you look out on the building that is 5 feet away! It is probably the worst view room at the inn. But I still loved it there and will come again and get a view room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, super service”
Reviews.Author: Donald T
Reviews.Content: As frequent visitors to the Seattle area, my wife and I have stayed here many times and each time the experience is better. It really is right at the Pike's Market with all of the fun that is associated. The Inn at the Market is a super clean hotel with a great staff. It's a Must stay hotel for anyone looking to get right down into the Seattle experience. Great food close by!

Reviews.Title: “DID'NT SLEEP ALL NIGHT LONG!”
Reviews.Author: palsr
Reviews.Content: Were given a room which faced busy downtown 1st Ave. Cute Boutique hotel in most excellent location at Pike St. Market with friendly staff, awesome view deck, and comfortable bedding...unfortunately, the windows facing busy night time street have not been upgraded and provided absolutely no acoustic respite from loud ongoing traffic, drinking crowd, or street people yelling all through the night! This along with intermittent window air conditioning unit going on and off continuously resulted in getting absolutely NO SLEEP!!! at all all night long!!! At check out we were not the only ones complaining about this! For this kind of money, this should not be happening at this establishment! Otherwise, it would have been great! If you do go whatever you do, DO NOT! take a street side room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Kat1978R
Reviews.Content: My husband and i had a beautiful room with a partial water view. The bellhop and front desk staff were very helpful, and prompt when we arrived. The 5th floor deck has lovely views of the harbor. The hotel is a very conveniently located close to the market and restaurants. We walked to dinner each night. Although we were concerned about the street noise during the day, the room was surprisingly quiet each night. Our only criticism would be for the high valet rate of $29.00 per day and the lack of a bar area on the deck. despite that, we will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JanHana
Reviews.Content: We got the Special Art Museum Package at Inn at the Market for our 3 day trip to Seattle. The customer service was first class and the location of this classy hotel was perfect! We took the light rail from the airport and got off at the Westlake station & walked 4 blocks to the hotel. We were early and they held our bags until the room was ready. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view and it was beautiful. There's a deck viewing area to soak in the views. The location next to Pikes Market is perfect because we could shop, eat, and rest anytime! The customer service was excellent! Beds were comfortable and we could see the ocean when we got up! I would definitely book this hotel again. The location, service and quality make Inn at the Market an excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Great location... PHENOMENAL view”
Reviews.Author: MechelleCoate
Reviews.Content: I normally stay in a bit less costly of hotels when traveling, but this hotel's location was perfect for my step mother who was traveling with us. It is within steps of the Market. We received a double room on the fourth floor, where both windows either looked out over the sound or the market. I couldn't have gotten a better view! It was beautiful. The beds were actually very comfortable, and the bathroom was very clean. Maid service daily did a great job picking up after our family. And turn down service left us a local candy on our night stands. The champagne, the cappucinno, and the milk chocolate were the best. The concierge night men were so friendly and helpful. They even had umbrellas to loan out, which was great since one of ours broke in the wind the first night. The only negative I have is the room service menues. The breakfast from Bacco's was just ok. And the night menu from the french restaurant was so limited none of us found anything at all interesting, which resulted in a quick walk to McDonald's instead. Completely and totally worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Best of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: BWeed
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Inn at the Market November 2011 for a Seattle Seahawks game. Spent 3 nights. Was truly the best location and best hotel I've stayed at in Seattle. Literally steps from Pike Place market make it perfect for early morning coffees overlooking the Sound. Was cold when we were there, so the deck you could sit on overlooking the Sound wasn't used, but its views were excellent. Valet parking was fast and efficient as well. Rooms were modern and clean as well. Great to be right on Post Alley as well and steps from Kells Irish Pub. Go there for great local bands. Also, we paid for the cheaper rooms and still had a great view of the Sound. Not sure why I'd pay more, but I'm sure it would be worth it. All in all, perfect hotel, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle's Best (not coffee)”
Reviews.Author: willbikeforwine
Reviews.Content: Spent another great weekend at the Inn, everything is wonderful from the valet to the reception you are welcomed warmly. We love the water view rooms, glass of wine and watch the world go by and the sun set. We did the art special, visited SAM, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, good service, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Reaughstar
Reviews.Content: We walked everywhere...to the link station (that's how we came in for the airport), to the monorail for the space needle, to eat at cafe campagne and the pink door, all through the market, and down to the waterfront and aquarium. The bellhops were very friendly and helpful--had a challenge getting a cab when we checked out but not for lack of effort. The room is very average- smallish and the bed faces the wall rather than the entertainment cabinet which is a little unusual. Bed very comfortable, 5th floor patio not to be missed...we happily ate our piroshkys in a light drizzle for that fantastic view!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kkf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 4 nights at Inn at the Market. The service was impeccable, Every employee that we came in contact with was polite and helpful. We knew that the weather would most likely not be that nice, but we still bundled up against the wind and cold and spent 2 evenings watching the sun set from the fabulous outdoor terrace. We booked a city view room, really wished we had booked a water view, but the property was full 2 of the nights so there wasn't an opportunity to upgrade. We were on the top floor, which was a wonderful bonus, but bring your earplugs, the night noise was pretty loud, especially after businesses closed on Saturday night (Sunday am). The short walk down the hill allowed for perfect access to Pike Place Market and the shops and restaurants of the area.

Reviews.Title: “A honeymoon to remember”
Reviews.Author: Sandra W
Reviews.Content: We arrived a few hours before the wedding, and the staff treated us like royalty. They were right there asking us if we needed anything and offering thier services at any time. The room was lovely and the view was incredible! We have stayed in this hotel before and everytime we stay the service surpasses our expectations. We will be back for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend oasis”
Reviews.Author: Kathalina916
Reviews.Content: Had limited time in the city with friends and wanted to be right in the center of things so IATM was perfect. Wandering around Pikes, with all the cute shops, tasting rooms, chocolate, coffee, incredible restaurants on the doorstep, all of that AND an amazing view! Can't be beat. Do think it was a bit pricey, but split the cost so were able to afford it, glad we did. Room was clean, beds super comfy, staff exceptionally friendly and helpful with recommendations. Couldn't ask for a better experience. Wish there was one in every city.

Reviews.Title: “Pike Place Market Best Bet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pickatripagain
Reviews.Content: Can't go to Seattle without visiting Pike Place Market. so why not just make it easy on yourself and stay at the Inn at the Market? We were there in August for a wedding ( about the only month you can plan an outdoor event) and the town is slammed with cruise ship tourists as thats the height of their season too. Don't even try to rent a car, - ridiculous parking rates and fees for downtown spots. We stayed at The Inn at the Market and loved the proxicimity to waterfront, ferries to out islands, museums and shops. Tasteful rooms, very clean. Just make sure you get a waterview room- worth the extra$ because the view is awesome. They also have a great rooftop deck for afternoons of wine and cheese from Bechlers at the corner.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyandSarah
Reviews.Content: We visit Seattle at least twice a year, and The Inn at the Market has been our hotel of choice for a very long time. The reasons are many: the rooms are spacious, tastefully decorated/ furnished, and quiet. A trip to the hotel's rooftop deck is a must for a panoramic view of Elliott Bay. The staff is welcoming and go out of their way to accommodate their guests..."welcome back!" is the usual greeting when we arrive. The Inn's prime location is a short walk to the Seattle Art Museum, the Seattle Symphony, shopping and many fine restaurants, including Cafe Campagne and Marche, both located on-site. If you're ready to ditch the corporate hotel experience, the Inn at the Market is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at The Market has its Good Points and A few Not So good”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Man_48_11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Inn at the Market on more than one occasion, mainly because I enjoy being close to the Public Market when I am in Seattle. This is an older "boutique" hotel, so the rooms are not exactly large, but they are kept clean and tidy, although the furnishing are a bit dated but are in keeping with the style of the hotel. The front desk staff for the most part is quite helpful, especially at arranging a limo (at a good price) to and from the airport or for other excursions. This hotel is a bit on the expensive side (average room is probably about $250 a night), but if you are lucky enough to get a room with a view of the market and Elliott Bay, then it's worth it. If you get a "garden view" (which may mean a view of a brick wall) then not so much. The best aspect of this hotel is its location!

Reviews.Title: “Hometown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: creichmuth
Reviews.Content: I was so fortunate to use Seattle as my base for a 4-week trek to 2 different continents. What was more incredible was using this special, unique, quaint, "Inn" as my base. Picturesque! Modern! Fantastic food! Excellent location. Peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azbobbie0962
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four nights last week, 2/24/12. We had a wonderful experience. I chose the hotel based on it's location, I had never stayed at a "boutique" type hotel so didn't know what to expect. Our room was exceptional, we stayed in room 808 which offers a great view of the market and of Puget Sound. I don't think we could have asked for a better room. The service from everyone at the hotel was oustanding, I have never experienced this level of customer service, and I have stayed at numerous hotels. Everyone is s0 incredibly nice, and it's genuine! From the desk clerks to Andrew who gave us a ride to the Space Needle, everyone was provided steller customer service. Since we didn't have out own vehicle, we appreciated having the hotel town car available to give us a ride. If I had to find fault with anything it would probably be that the water pressure to fill the bath tub is a little slow. Other than that it was perfect. I would caution those traveling with kids, this is a boutique hotel which means that it does not offer some of the amenities that your larger resort style hotesl offer, ie, pool, spa, etc. I would definately stay here again and would recommend it. I fear that I'm ruined for any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and beautiful views of Puget Sound were what stood out the most.”
Reviews.Author: travelcandt
Reviews.Content: We were staying in Seattle for two nights after a several day ski trip in Whistler, B.C. and before flying home to NY. After the long drive back to Seattle through the mountains, the hotel was a welcome comfort. Upon arrival, we were promptly greeted in front of the hotel by the friendly valet attendant who also assisted us with our bags into the lobby. At check in, we were happy to hear that we got a complimentary upgrade to our room. The room was clean, plenty of space, and upon entering, we noticed the beautiful view looking out onto the Puget Sound, and it just so happened to be sunset. Our king size bed was lush and enveloped us in goose down comforter and pillows. Our bathroom, also spacious was immaculate and well appointed. We had plenty of room in the hotel fridge to store our small amount of travel snacks and drinks. The concierge was helpful in suggesting a place to eat, and we explored the area surrounding the hotel, which happens to be smack in the middle of the Public Market at Pike Place. Tons to see, tons of places to shop, eat and grab coffee. We even enjoyed an after dinner stroll on the outdoor garden of the hotel which is safely perched up on the 5th floor. If it had been warmer, I would have loved to have pre dinner drinks on this deck. Check out went smoothly and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: gr8day4play
Reviews.Content: Every single employee we encountered impressed us with there helpfulness, politeness and great overall attitude. We have never seen 100% service like this before. The property is located right at Pikes Pier - a should be staple for perusing through every day. Remodeling property next door and an antiquated heating system did not dampen our experience. Great view of the sound and terrific food. Truly excellent experience overall. Thanks, mcj

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Jem”
Reviews.Author: beachbumbrandi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and will always come back as the charm never wears off. The quaintness of the Inn will charm anyone who enters. As far as the rooftop patio with BBQ's and loungers, you cant beat the view. After a day of shopping or business, sitting with a glass of wine in hand watching the ferry cross the sound is just perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: DramaQueenFlip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Seattle last 8-12 January to train under Jason Prefontaine, from whom we bought a custom made Slayer espresso machine for our coffee shop. After perusing the reviews of various Seattle hotels here on Trip Advisor, I decided to book us at the Inn at the Market. We were very pleased with our choice! Our room was spacious and had a beautiful view of the water, the bed was quite comfortable, enough to make it difficult to get up in the mornings. The bathroom was clean and spacious, stocked daily with Gilchrist & Soames toiletries. My only beef with the bathroom was that the shower was incorporated into the tub, it was just a little bit inconvenient, but it didn't detract from the quality of our stay. Housekeeping was quite thorough, our room was always well cleaned daily. The door men were always amiable and helpful, and so were the front desk staff. The hotel had no restaurants, but it was within a little courtyard that also included the superb Cafe Campagne which served lovely French cuisine (We had dinner two nights in a row!); Bacco, a cafe that was only open for breakfast, which was quite satisfying; and Marche which we patronized every night for desert and drinks after dinner. There were also some interesting looking shops and a salon in the courtyard which I was never able to visit because by the time we would get back from training, they were all closed. The staff at Cafe Campagne and Marche were very friendly and helpful. We thought my husband left his cellphone at Marche on our last night and the staff helped him turn the place around to search for it. We loved Seattle and Inn at the Market, and would like to come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Inn at the Market - great for anniversaries!”
Reviews.Author: Sue W
Reviews.Content: We recently spent our 20th wedding anniversary here and realized that we have done more anniversaries here than anywhere else. The Inn's location is wonderful with Pike Place Market and 1st Avenue so close; lots to see and do. The rooms are large and full of light, the bed was wonderfully comfortable, and staff were helpful and friendly. We had reserved a city view room but when they found it was our anniversary, gave us a free upgrade to a water view room - and a deliciious chocolate dessert in our room. The rooftop deck expands the view even more and is a great place to spend time. We spent time at the Market, had a martini at the Triple Door (live happy hour music, no cover) and a delicious dinner at Chez Shea. We love the Inn and I'm sure we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: tumblentumbleweeds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed February 12th until February 15th, 2012. We had a water view room at the rate of $245 per night/ $855 with tax. The room was clean and the staff terrific. We had a poorly operating coffee pot and it was immediately replaced with one that worked. The pillows were too soft, so we asked if we could have an extra one. The staff immediately came up with two tempurpedic pillows. I was impressed. When we got home we were asked by management to take a survey regarding our stay. I happened to mention the refusal of the Orange Cab driver, who took us to the airport, to give us the flat rate of $32, as stated on the cab's passenger window and confirmed by another cab driver, who had told us rates are metered when coming FROM the airport but charged a flat rate when GOING to the airport. Our cab driver stated we needed a form, provided by the hotel, in order to get the rate. Not true! I had also researched cab fares on the internet before leaving home. The manager of the Inn at the Market advised he would refer this cab incident to the transporation authority. I also sent an e-mail to Orange Cab advising I would not use their company in the future. I have not heard back for them---Go figure. Anyway, the only negative I have regarding our stay was the decor of our room. I actually laid in bed thinking a change in the pictures on the wall and the curtains would help. The room has a bit of a tired look and not pulled together. I also had an issue with the blower on the heater. It is winter and it is possible dust was blown into the air, as my eyes instantly acted up, when the heater went on. Would I stay there again or even recommend the hotel to friends--of course. You can't beat the location and everyone was happy to please. I also appreciated the secure office center, in order to print up our boading passes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: TS_Elppy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in January 2012. Great, spacious room (I asked for an upgrade), with a stunning view of the water and great access to the Marketplace. Terrific restaurants nearby (including those right in the complex). Great staff. Looking forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location--great beds and lovely sheets”
Reviews.Author: loulouL.A.
Reviews.Content: This place spends its money where it counts-the beds are fantastic, the sheets divine, the pillows cloud-like...and of course, the location can't be beat. But frankly, that is all that recommends the place--outside of what I mentioned, the rooms are rather plebeian, at best. We had a street side room, which was tiny, and the water pressure SUcked--could barely rinse my hair. The bathrooms need a make-over--they look like what they probably are--spiffied-up Holiday Innish. At the very least, make sure that the fixtures aren't falling off the wall. We had a TERRible tip from front desk staff about where to go to eat, so don't bother asking--they either don't know or they get a kickback--either way, they are not to be trusted. WE paid $160 a night, including valet parking, which for the location (and those sheets and bed--ahhhhh) still seemed reasonable for Seattle. Yes, I'd go back--just for the sleep and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, view and bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline B
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the central location - close to bus routes and shopping. The view can't be beat and the bed is absolutely the most comfortable one we have had. Staff is wonderful. Walking distance to our planned evening activity at the Triple Door. Thanks for a wonderfully relaxing and comfortable Valentine getaway! Can't wait ot come back!!! The only thing that could make this even more special would be more coffee in the room and a hot tub on the deck!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient-nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pdxfamily3
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that the location is not to be believed. Literally steps from the Pike Place Market and close to everything we wanted to do in Seattle. The first night here was a bit rough as we had a city view room (only room available at the time of my reservation). Well, it's not a view as much as a room facing 1st street. It was very loud. Traffic noise until way past 1am! Needless to say I was "Sleepless in Seattle". The next morning I called the front desk and luckily they were able to move us to a "Courtyard Room". Much better! This was a bigger room and quiet. The rooms are comfortable and modest in size-the bed was excellent. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. There is no gym or pool on the property which is a negative for my family but they do give you a free pass to a local gym. Coffee and tea are provided in the lobby in the morning and apples and cookies are on a plate by the front desk in the afternoon. There are 2 restaurants you can order room service from but no children's menu or child friendly food. Luckily, there are so many restaurants close by we were able to get what we needed. Nice rooftop patio area to enjoy the view. I guess this review is fairly neutral-It's a nice hotel BUT...after reading all the reviews on TripAdvisor I guess I was just expecting more.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Inn at the Market”
Reviews.Author: jrlieb
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, spectacular view, top-notch service, and realistic price. We actually live in Seattle but want an occasional getaway from our kids and have an in-city experience. Staying at this perfect little hotel made us start perusing the internet for downtown condos for sale, but really, a night at the Inn at the Market is a much more economical way to get the feeling of living right above the Market without actually making the move.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at Market - Seattle”
Reviews.Author: ken c
Reviews.Content: Staff actually made you feel wanted and as result - very comfortable. They helped with name of hotel in Vancouver - The Listel - which is comparable size hotel and also very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: kbrimberry
Reviews.Content: Excellent Service, Hotel and Location. Staff extremely helpful and friendly and hotel of amazing quality.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany L
Reviews.Content: The staff was super friendly and the location couldn't have been better. The facilities were great and the bed was comfortable. We were just steps away from Pikes Place Market. We could actually see the market from our room. We were also given an upgrade when we arrived. I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: PeterCG
Reviews.Content: Ideal for those who like to stay in the middle of downtown and to be able to get around on foot. My room was smart and spacious, service was very good, wifi connection in the room was reliable. If there was one small negative point, it was that the heater/aircon unit in my room was a bit loud when in operation. But overall, very good value for money. I found this hotel via TripAdvisor and, for the first time, tried clicking the "show prices" button. I was surprised at how much the quotes varied: the cheapest included one night's free stay, saving me over $100.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: SuziSpotlight
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for my birthday and although we are locals and work downtown, we truly felt that we "got away" for a night at this magical hotel in an amazing setting!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this quiet boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MommiAnna
Reviews.Content: First trip to Seattle and stumbled on this inn. Great location, never needed a car, had a cute breakfast nook with awesome made to order juices downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Milagros!”
Reviews.Author: Cymraegi
Reviews.Content: This place is a miracle! I can hardly articulate how amazing it was; the bed was lucious, the room was perfectly positioned for seeing one of Seattle's most beautiful sights, and the staff were perfectly delightful. Thank you so much for such a magical experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to Market”
Reviews.Author: Dennis F
Reviews.Content: I was playing in the Seattle Open so access to the Seattle Athletic Club is excellent. I know this is a review for the hotel but the athletic club is awesome and babysitting services for over 2 months. The hotel is clean and staff are very friendly. 1/2 block from Pike Place market. I was there with my wife, 4yr old and 11m old. Nice big bathroom, good internet access, and nice comfy beds. Dislikes: 1) Room heater is in the room; somewhat loud but could be turned off. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: cookiechiv
Reviews.Content: The room was amazing , the bed was luscious and the location was great. Our room was overlooking the market and it was fun to watch the hustle and bustle as the vendors prepared to open at dawn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for our first trip to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Chililover
Reviews.Content: After a long trip from Melbourne we arrived at the very welcoming lobby of the Inn at the Market. Receptionist and Bell Man both extremely friendly and helpful and our room was ready for us. The first impression was outstanding and the lobby had a delicious aroma... Complimentary coffee, fruit and cookies were on offer as well. We had booked a parlour suite which was a lovley big room with a good sized seperate sitting area, we had a great view of the market and out to the Sound. The room was very nicely appointed, bed was very comfortable, bathroom good although the shower could have used a bit more water pressure. There was also a good sized fridge so you could buy drinks outside the hotel and keep them cold. The concierge arranged a tour to the Boeing Factory for us which was very worthwhile, the Museum of Flight was absolutely outstanding as well. The best meal we had was at Wild Ginger, about a ten minute walk, also enjoyed Steelhead Diner across the road, Elliots Oyster House on one of the wharfs and we also enjoyed Etta's which is right near the market. Would not hesitate to return if we find ourselves in Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “the best place to relax !”
Reviews.Author: katary_12
Reviews.Content: i had a week in this hotel on last November.this is a great hotel. There are a bar, market anf downtown shopping.it is located is wonderful.Staff are honest and professional. The best view with water. I need to relax and its not noise. In my opinion, it is a great hotel =)

Reviews.Title: “Can't agree more with the top 25 rating!”
Reviews.Author: Erdut
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived every staff member was curtious and helpful. The Valets are a kick! The front desk staff top notch. The location can't be beat. The rooms are fabulous. When you go be sure to check out the roof top deck.........perfect place for a cup of coffee in the morning or better yet a glass of wine at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Slimjims
Reviews.Content: Best location in downtown. Classy rooms, spacious, and quiet. Excellent service. Only thing is that the building was a bit old. Perfect hotel if you have 2 days to spend downtown, u can shop, drop stuff off at hotel by walking back, and continue shopping after. A bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Gkrieger
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located in central business area; staff was good and responsive, nearby restaurants are fine; problem is heating/ventilation system, very noisy and intermittently runs regardless of how it is seemingly set, call to maintenance unable to resolve so I assume inherent to the system. Possible that it is room specific but I doubt this.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat ..”
Reviews.Author: Steve541
Reviews.Content: Travelled here from Vancouver for an overnight stay. the hotel is situated right next to Pine Street which is right at te junction with Pike Street and it's fantastic market. The hotel is a boutique style with an open courtyard to the front. On entering you are met with nice fire and seating area. The staff are young an very attentive and knowledgable. Something that seems to be consistant with Seattle but here they were over and above. We were met with cookies that had just come out of the oven which was a nice touch. The room was fantastic, very nice furniture, well stocked coffee/mini bar area and great media. Big 42 inch flat screen with good movie selection and alarm / speaker with iPhone connectivitivy. Free wi fi as well. We asked for recommendations for dinner and were given three options. We tried an Italian called The Red Door - amazing. the hotel is a short walk (10 mins) to the old town which I would also recommend for its cool independent shops. A great city, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooftop desk”
Reviews.Author: AndreaLeverkusen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Inn at the Market and we loved it. We booked a city side room and were completely happy with that. You have a nice look into the city and we spend both evenings on the rooftop deck with a wonderful view to the water, the harbour and the market. You can bring your own wine and food to the rooftop deck and we did so. That had been the nicest and relaxed evenings on our whole trip! The beds have been comfy, otherwise we did not spend a lot of time in our room as the city is very interesting. The market is right in front of the hotel. Although you have to pay for it I would prefer valet parking again. As in all big cities you can get a problem with the parking space otherwise. And the service war really quick and courteous, We did not need our car during the time we were staying here. When we wanted to go farther away we took the bus or the monorail (to the Space Needle). We did not visit the restaurants so we can´t give a feedback about them. We definitely would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Service is the best!”
Reviews.Author: B L
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel in a great location. I have been wanting to stay at the Inn for years, having seen it walking to Pike Place Market. When I needed to travel to Seattle for business, I finally had the opportunity to book a stay there and my wait was generously rewarded. The hotel staff are excellent and made me feel like their only guest. All my needs were met with a generous spirit and my stay was everything I hoped it would be. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, warm atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Laura K
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Market and downtown shopping. No workout facility but passes are provided to Seattle Athletic club two blocks away. Concierge and Front Desk staff very friendly. No problems calling a cab...they come right away. Had a city view, but high up, no problem with noise. A little cold during my stay so did not use the deck, but this amenity looks fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas visit to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: GPSIG
Reviews.Content: Back for the second time to The Inn at The Market in Seattle for Christmas. They were able to add an additional room for our family while we were in route for our stay. Never fail to provide excellent service. Have booked for our three Seattle trips in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with every extra thought of”
Reviews.Author: Sam_David_au
Reviews.Content: This hotel is how a hotel would be if I planned and decorated myself. Every extra is included - even has individual reading lights above the bed in case you wake and want to read without disturbing your partner. Decorated beautifully and tastefully. The beds were like sleeping on clouds with soft top quality bed linen. We also used a roll away and even it was comfortable. Toiletries supplied were of high quality, even robes were offered. The staff were warm, welcoming and helpful; they even have a turn down service complete with complimentary chocolates. Wonderfully situated RIGHT next to the fabulous market, it has restaurants, bars and cafes galore. Our only disappointment, we only had one night here. We will be back ASAP!

Reviews.Title: “The best place!”
Reviews.Author: TrishnRic
Reviews.Content: Can't wait to go back to Seatlle just to stay here! The staff is excellent and I can't say enough about them. Hotel is very clean and you can't get a better location close to the fish market. We had a water view and it was beyond what we expected. Everything is within walking distance. Price was excellent. We highly recommend this hotel and are looking forward to going back again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite perfect”
Reviews.Author: hahnecho
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with puzzling imperfections. To begin with, the other reviews are on the mark in terms of location, charm, etc. Those features are top notch. So, what's my complaint? For a top-notch hotel for which the bar should be set high for details, the hotel fell short in several puzzling ways. We checked in late at night; the night clerk was competent and helpful. The Guest Service Directory had a dusty cover. No big deal, I thought. The room was nice but with only one coffee cup (but two saucers and two spoons). The coffee quality in the room was excellent but I had to go downstairs to ask for packets of sugar -- two nights in a row. (There was plenty of artificial sweeteners but no regular sugar.) The concierge gave me a handful the second time so I would not have to come back. The coffee maker was only partially cleaned one day (grounds were removed but the carafe was not washed). A dirty saucer was clearly not replaced one day; it still had coffee spillage on it. There was only one drinking glass one night and a glass was visibly cracked on a different day. There was a bedside lamp in which the light socket had come apart. That did not pose acute danger because the exposed wires were insulated and the switch was on the cord so the socket did not need to be touched. Perhaps the most annoying (minor) problems were with the shower/bath. The stopper -- the type where you just push down to toggle between close and open -- was very unresponsive and difficult to close. Equally inconvenient was the way the shower curtains were set up. There are two adjacent parallel shower curtain rods. I believe the inner bar is for the main curtain and the outer bar for the "decorative" outer curtains. In our bathroom, both curtains were on the same (outer) rod which meant that the edge of the inner curtain could not be placed near the wall because the outer curtain's (which was split into two pieces) hangers took up the space on the curtain rod closest to the wall. The inner curtain rod was not being used at all. Sorry for the convoluted explanation but the bottom line is that the inner curtain would not close against the wall so it was difficult to keep the water from splashing out of the shower. The bottom line: these are problems that we might be tempted to tolerate at a cheap motel but, perhaps, not even then. Inn at the Market should pay more attention to such details before I can give an unqualified endorsement to an otherwise excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tfal06
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated her birthday at this wonderful hotel. The staff, hotel condition and cleanliness were all perfect. We will be back! Plus, you really can't beat the location in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor ratings were spot on!”
Reviews.Author: avidforafrica
Reviews.Content: Lovely property, extremely welcoming, great location, comfortable rooms. Would definitely want to stay longer and check in again. I was not able to book a waterfront room (the hotel was too busy), but i loved my room overlooking 1st Avenue. Lively but not noisy, the chairs in the window area were perfect, excellent room and fine room location. As one would hope in Seattle, even the in-room coffee was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking and stay here”
Reviews.Author: ButchChicago
Reviews.Content: Great bars and food places nearby. View of the water. Staff is great. Stop at Beechers Cheese at the market. This is the best place to stay, especially if you want something different than a Chain Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ACAFlyer
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend at the Inn at the Market based on a friend’s recommendation. Their Counter Staff were the best and most personable I have met at any Hotel world-wide. I left my "liquids bag" at TSA and asked about replacements at the desk. I received mini-Shaving cream, Toothbrush, Toothpaste, Deodorant, and Razor. Yippeee! The Hotel overlooks Pike Place Market. (From my “Water View” room, I could see Puget Sound, the Pike Place Fish Market and the fish being thrown by Pike Place Fish. On the other hand, "City View" rooms have only a view of a few downtown Seattle buildings.) The beds were comfy. There was even an umbrella in the closet if needed. The Hotel is easy to find. From the Airport via Light Rail the Station it is five blocks away straight down Pine St. at the intersection with 1st Ave. Valet Parking is available if you drive. There is plenty to do, see, and eat, within walking distance. This is an excellent Hotel without being pretentious from the Doorman right down to the Maids.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryans69
Reviews.Content: The location of Inn at the Market is absolutely perfect! This is the most central you can feel in Seattle. Short walk to shopping and dining destinations, or anything downtown. My partial water view room was large and had a great water view (better than "partial") looking over and past the 5th floor roof deck. This was a free, unrequested upgrade from a City Side room, by the way. The hotel offers great dining options onsite. Room service menu is outstanding. The sheets and pillows are high quality. Lobby is quite small, so it wouldn't be a good choice if you are trying to hold business chats or other get togethers in the lobby area of your hotel. Overall, if you want a very Seattle feeling hotel with great ambiance and staff, this is the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “the three c's: comfy, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: trvln_foodie
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel. We wanted to visit Seattle on the cheap so we only could spend just one night there. So we decided splurge on this conveniently located hotel so we could maximize our time. We were so happy we did! This hotel is literally steps away from Pikes Public market where we spent a huge chunk of our time at. Its also just a few blocks away from the light rail and the tram to the Space needle! (P.S. the light rail was so freakin' inexpensive and convenient from the airport to downtown, its a definite must for those on a budget or for those who would rather have the extra cash on hand) The staff were so nice and accommodating as they kept our luggage before check in and after check out so we could sightsee more. The rooftop terrace is Awesome as the views.were impressive and the smacks and wine were great! The rooms were nicely spacious and they have the brand of toiletries from England that I love. Rooms were spotless and the bed was uber relaxing to be in. We would definetly go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Indulge yourself...”
Reviews.Author: beardiegal
Reviews.Content: Quiet, understated elegance, convenient location... Have been to Seattle several times, stayed in several places, but if you have limited time, and really want to treat yourself, this is your best choice... Location, location, location... The Pike Market is at your doorstep, the central district is a two block walk, the waterfront is at your doorstep, and a gorgeous deck provides a private outlook over the sound (feels like your own personal back yard-sadly, the clerk forgot to mention it to me when I checked in, but after a couple days, I asked "where is the rooftop looking place you featured in your ad' and was directed to it) ...A basket of apples awaits you at the front desk, spacious rooms, vey comfy beds, usual ipod docking alarm clock, extremely helpful concierge and staff, willing valets for parking... only drawbacks are a function of the small size and intimacy - no spa, no workout room, the business center is a small room with only two computers (may mean a short wait)... I had a city view room (ok), would ask for waterview, (so much more relaxing)...

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: bkkesler
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful, romantic stay at the Inn at the Market! It's all about the little things here: a free gift-wrapping station during the Christmas season that my wife took full advantage of, personal service (even the bellman remembered my name), and turn-down chocolates in the evening. And of course, that location!! Right smack in the middle of one of the great urban shopping and eating areas in the nation, with Pike Place Market at your feet and all the great stores of Seattle just a few blocks away. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: North Palm Beach, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “5 star service!”
Reviews.Author: Haley H
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of this hotel after reading so many positive reviews on Trip Advisor and seeing photos. The hotel itself in terms of the building and decor were not quite what I expected; it was very understated and minimal. This isn't necessarily bad, just not what I expected. However, everything was impeccably clean. What really sets this hotel apart from many is the outstanding SERVICE that they give. Everyone was exceedingly friendly and any service you could hope for was immediately undertaken. Through their use of earpiece communication they could make sure that information was relayed almost the instant you request it. Being in the high end hospitality industry myself, this is the level of service I expect to see when going to other high end establishments. Even the housekeeping staff was friendly and pleasant when bypassing in the hall, not scampering away or hiding behind service trucks. We dined at both Marche and Bacco, their on-site restaurants. Both were very good if not excellent. Bottom line, if you want great service with a clean room and excellent location, this is your hotel. If you relish in the opulence of typical 4- and 5- star hotels, this might not be a great fit for you.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best ever”
Reviews.Author: Fred D
Reviews.Content: Love staying here when I can. Perfect location mixed with the perfect staff and attention. Can't say enough about them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelling_rocks
Reviews.Content: My only complaint about our stay at the Inn at the Market was that it was too short. I love the location right by the market, with all those restaurants and shops right at your door step. Entire hotel is surprisingly quiet, even the street noise did not bother us at all. Nice and spacious room, huge bathroom and a very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy929
Reviews.Content: Sadly I was only in Seattle one night - I had never been to the city before so I wanted to stay somewhere that was in the middle of things, that way I could see as much I as could in the short time I was there. The Inn at the Market has a great location - right at Pike's Place Market and surrounded by great places to eat and very close to LOTS of shopping (which makes every girl happy :) ) The room was very clean, the bed was SOOOO comfortable, and the people in the hotel couldn't have been nicer. I did the valet parking (work was paying, so why not?) which wasn't much more than the nearby lots and very convenient - so even if I was paying for it I would have done it. When I needed my car I just called down to the lobby a few minutes before I planned to leave and my car was waiting right there for me when I came downstairs. When you first walk in, the lobby is very warm and inviting. Any and all questions I had were answered by the people working the desk and they were extremely helpful. I had a light lunch at (what I think was called) the Pear Deli around the corner. It was just a cute little deli with a couple of little tables and my sandwich was awesome. For dinner that night I went over to the restaurant across the street (whose name escapes me - but the guy at the front desk recommended) and it was amazing. I took a nice long walk all through the market and then up towards the center of town where there were lots of cool shops and cool people. After having a great meal and a nice stroll I came back to my room to see that my bed had been turned down, complete with chocolates (not on the pillow, but on the desk next to the bed lol) I had to do some work (Which is why I was there in the first place - Boo!) but when I was finally able to go to bed, the bed couldn't have been more comfortable. Slept great, got out on time to go to my meeting and then was off to the airport. If/when I go to Seattle again (I hope it's more a question of 'when' since I would have loved to explore the city for more than a couple of hours) I would absolutely stay at the Inn at the Market.

Reviews.Title: “A top-quality boutique hotel in an unrivalled location”
Reviews.Author: btsaus
Reviews.Content: I have a married niece who lives in Seattle. When I first visited Seattle in order to see her and her then new husband, she and I discussed the hotel possibilities. Of the two or three obvious choices I chose the Inn. I have visited Seattle every year since 2001 and I stay at the Inn as a matter of course. It is a small boutique hotel. its presentation is outstandingly good. Its facilities are first rate. It has no restaurant, but in the same building is Bacco, an excellent place for breakfast, and Campagna, a restaurant seving food of a quality that I have never found to be less than excellent. Its location is ideal: a stone's throw from the celebrated Pike Place Market; surrounded by very good places to eat, (try the recently opened Diner across the street from the main entrance to the Inn); within a comfortable walk from the Seattle Museum of Art and Benaroya Hall, the home of the Seattle Symphony Orchestra. A walk of a couple of blocks reaches the monorail that travels back and forth between the Westlake Centre downtown and the Seattle Centre, which contins, among much else, the Seattle Opera and the Pacific North West Ballet. The staff are uniformly agreeable and efficient. The air conditioner in my room was a bit noisy, but given the outside temperatures in November, I didn't mind. I simply warmed the room well and before turning out the light at bedtime, and turned off the A/C while I slept. A top choice

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle location”
Reviews.Author: Nampa_Guy
Reviews.Content: We did a short holiday trip to Seattle and stayed here. The service was excellent, with staff always at the ready. The entire property is well kept and comfortable. It is within very easy walking distance of most downtown Seattle attractions - and looks out on the Pike Street market area. Very convenient for both R&R and business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joel052
Reviews.Content: Friends suggested that we stay at this hotel over Thanksgiving. The room was very nice and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. Most restaurants were closed so the htoel offered free coffee and a continental breakfast on Thanksgiving day. Valet parking is available at a much more reasonable price than other hotels in the area. All in all a great place to stay only steps from Pike Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Thanksgiving Weekend at the Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Joyce Z
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in three rooms over the Thanksgiving Weekend and everyone had a great experience! Our harbor-view suite was beautifully appointed and became the perfect meeting place before and after excursions. The activity at the market and in the harbor was as much fun to watch as the football games on TV. The central location made it the perfect spot for an activity packed weekend!

Reviews.Title: “On Top of the World”
Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally placed near Pike Place Market, great restaurants and entertainment on the water front - all within walking distance. The staff were all most helpful; the rooms most comfortable and the view from the roof garden spectacular! Our other friends in Seattle - 2 couples staying at other hotels - were very envious. The Taylors from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out great for me and my family!”
Reviews.Author: pinhigh18
Reviews.Content: Worked out great for me and my family! Combined business and family travel. I could walk to the convention center for a tech conference each morning, no problem. With the IATM location literally on top of Pike Place Market made it great for the family. They could stroll through each day and get what they each wanted to eat and either eat at the market or take it back to the hotel. As for the hotel itself, we were fortunate to get a room that suited us perfectly. Two queens and plenty of room - I would almost consider this one a suite. Also, we had a tremendous view of the Sound. Great sunsets. The staff members were profressional, courteous and genuinely seemed to enjoy their work and taking care of us. The linens, comforters, pillows and mattress quality were perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Seattle and great views”
Reviews.Author: pilsen_pete
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and the place was amazing. The room size was ok, but it had a floor-to-ceiling windows with a perfect view of the Pike Place Market, the Puget Sound and the mountains on the Olympic peninsula. I would just walk down to the different places around the market for breakfast and lunch, because it is right outside the hotel front door - it was quite awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne49680
Reviews.Content: I had a rough start with some problems with my reservation but the staff more than made up for it. The location and views from the waterview rooms also make this the place to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location”
Reviews.Author: TTraveler24
Reviews.Content: If you can afford the cost, there is nothing in Seattle like the Inn at the Market. We love the combination of first-rate accommodations and service and proximity to Pike Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “IATM”
Reviews.Author: cbmoler
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant small hotel in a terrific location. Our meeting took over most of the big hotels in town. My wife was with me so I chose IATM and we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: janeff08
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for walking around and seeing the city by foot. Tons of restaurant choices, tours, and sights within a few minutes walk, and a beautiful room to top it off. They were very accommodating to an early check in and late check out, great customer service. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: garf47
Reviews.Content: I visited Seattle for the first time last month for a cousin's wedding and extended my stay for a few days on my own to get to know the city. The Inn at the Market was perfect: steps from the Public Market and very easy walking distance to other great sites and/or public transportation to get to points further out. Great bed, awesome waterfront view, nice rooftop deck overlooking the Market and Puget Sound, very friendly and accomodating staff. I've run out of superlatives so I'll leave with: If you go, I hope 'the mountain comes out' as the view is spectacular. Not sure how likely that is, as I believe I actually found a place with fewer sunny days than Rochester NY!

Reviews.Title: “best bed and bedding”
Reviews.Author: sarawelder
Reviews.Content: I always travel with my own down pillow as I usually hate hotel pillows. The pillows here were exceptional.. the best ever hotel pillows.. I won't bring my own next time. The bed was firm with a soft topping.. great for a good night's sleep and perfect for a back that has walked all day. The location is so good that you really can walk most places from here. Staff were all way above average, professional and pleasant. I had a room with a "partial view" of the ocean. Actually I had a spectacular view as I had 3 windows and the city was just as interesting. Lots of natural light was a real plus for me. I would definitely recommend this to a friend and stay here on my next Seattle visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: Muskymaj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The rooms are spacious. They brought a rool away (free of charge) so we only needed 1 room for the five of us. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. We will be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: Puddin09
Reviews.Content: Wonderful view Room was very nice Enjoyed my stay Would return

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: jena396
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay in Seattle, this hotel offers everything right outside its doors..the Market, the ferry, restaurants, and many things to do and see. The only thing I was missing was a fireplace in the room to warm up from checking out all that Seattle has to offer. The staff was great and the view from our room was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: musiclady88
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is 1st class! We especially loved the bed! So comfortable we slept like a baby! Great view of the waterfront. Nice rooftop deck to relax on. Walked right out the door to Pike Place Market. Everyone was super friendly and accomodating. Would stay here again in a flash!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for a city visit”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely adored our stay at the Inn. We stayed there the last day of our Seattle trip (10-31-11) to celebrate our anniversary. We will DEFINITELY be back, and we've decided it will be the only place we stay when we are in Seattle! We were greeted with smiles & amazing service, allowed to check in early, and when we got back to our room there were these delightful cupcakes and a beautiful card wishing us a happy 5th anniversary. Such a sweet touch! We LOVED our stay-- the room was quiet (room #704, water view room, overlooking Pike's Place), the view was AH-MAAAAZING, and the staff was above & beyond FANTASTIC! The bathroom was spacious and very, very clean. From the valet parking to the front desk staff to the bellhop, everyone was so nice. We will ABSOLUTELY be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay at Inn at the Market”
Reviews.Author: StephanieLuvs2Travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and our 10 month old daughter, stayed at the Inn at the Market for 5 nights at the beginning of October, 2011. We loved everything about it! The staff was very accommodating; the location was perfect (literally steps away from Pike Place Market, and walking distance to many area attractions/restaurants); and the rooftop deck had amazing views! We stayed in a city view townhouse, and it was a great set-up... our baby could sleep/nap upstairs while we utilized the downstairs living area. Each evening we took drinks and snacks up to the deck to enjoy the view. We highly recommend the Inn, and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Get the town house if you have the budget!”
Reviews.Author: Summit4321
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in the two story townhouse. Nice comfortable living room downstairs with wet bar, upstairs bedroom and bathroom. #702 was I think the best room possible, on the 7th and 8th (top) floor in the corner with windows on two sides. The views of Pike Market and Puget Sound could not be beat. Fun to cruise the market and be back at your room in two minutes. Entertained some friends in the room before going to dinner, everyone enjoyed! Beds were like sleeping in a cloud!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Seattle, WA hotel”
Reviews.Author: keelx2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Innat at the Market a number of times and it's always my first choice for Seattle. The location is wonderful, within blocks from almost anything you want to visit. The rooms are super comfortable, with beds that are out of this world. But, best of all are the friendliness, competence, and professionalism of the staff. The fact that the Inn is just steps away from the Pikes Place Market is just icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: VegasN8tive
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Seattle and this location was directly selected based upon tripadvisor reviews and the willingness of manager David Watkins to respond to comments.We knew that the hotel stay for us, was going to be at least 60/70 percent of our overall experience to Seattle. So, we wanted location, location and an ability to just hang out and enjoy the views. Turned out, the weather was great and the location only enhanced our walking experience to everything "downtown". Not sure if I can mention room #'s or not but there are 2 rooms that have very private access to an incredible balcony. The "common area" hotel balcony on the 5th floor is amazing enough but if you want an extra special touch, spend the extra $$ and get 1 of the 2 rooms on the 7th floor that have private access to a huuggee balcony that is only accessible to said 2 rooms. Overall, this was a lot of money for us on a room but in retrospect, it was worth every single nickel and I kinda feel like I should send them a few more $$. Highlights for us on the staff were, Landon, Paulie and Katie. Staff even confirmed and verified (hi Katie) a craigslist ticket purchase that I made to a Seahawks game. Stay here now if you want the ultimate Seattle experience (rain or shine)! One very small complaint worth mentioning is that "Post Alley" can get a little rowdy on the weekends so light sleepers could have an issue with some late night/early morning noise if your visit is close to the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: thefeff
Reviews.Content: Hotel per se is clean, spacious and in a great location. Will stay there again without hesitation. However, I would recommend that you get a room that is not located right over the street as the noise from the street penetrates though the single pane windows. Either higher up or toward the coast view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mover625
Reviews.Content: A great location, very comfortable and good service but .... avoid the rooms fronting 1st Avenue - these can be noisy!

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of the Action”
Reviews.Author: 60sgal
Reviews.Content: This is THE place to stay if you want to be in the middle of the market scene in Seattle. It's delightful to wake up early and walk among the market stalls while the vendors are just setting up. We were fortunate to have gorgeous fall weather when we stayed here in mid-October. We did have a little trouble getting in. The room was not ready at 4 p.m., the normal check-in time, but we couldn't really complain because when we came back at 4:30 the room was ready and we had been upgraded to a suite with a perfect view of the iconic market sign, Elliott Bay and the Olympic Mountains beyond. This was a suite on two floors, with a large living room and kitchen downstairs and a spacious master bedroom and bathroom upstairs. Bed was very comfortable with great reading lights. We caught the beautiful sunset from the hotel's rooftop deck, where a lot of folks were sharing glasses of wine and snapping photos of the view. This is a great base for exploring Seattle. We walked down First Avenue to the Seattle Art Museum's sculpture park near Belltown and then walked back on the waterfront. Had breakfast at Seatown, one of Tom Douglas's newer restaurants, with an emphasis on smoked fish. Also walked the other direction, toward Pioneer Square, and of course checked out the fish, produce and craft stalls in the market itself. My only small caution would be that if you are looking for peace and quiet, this is probably not the place you want to be. The traffic noise from the viaduct below was quite loud all night even though I had my earplugs in. And the market action starts early so if you are a light sleeper you may have trouble sleeping in.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: chloe4245
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels in Seattle but have walked by the Inn At the Market and always wanted to give it a try. The Courtyard is beautiful and the hotel did not disappoint. The valet parking and bellhop services were quick and efficient. The check-in was friendly and took no time at all. I was given a room on the 5th floor which was right across the courtyard from the observation deck with a view of the ocean. Amazing view and it was convenient to be on the same floor as the deck where you could watch the sunset and the action at the Market. I purchased a package and my room had fresh fall flowers and valet parking was included. The bed and linens were luxurious and very comfortable.The bathroom was large and had great lighting and a makeup mirror. I appreciated the in-room fridge and complementary coffee in the mornings in the lobby. I ordered room service once and my food came quickly and hot. You could not ask for a more central location in downtown Seattle. It was a short walk to everything I wanted to do while downtown. The hotel was a beautiful oasis in the bustling Pike Market area.I think it is the perfect location to experience Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect getaway in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: OrcasParrothead
Reviews.Content: My wife and I FINALLY had a chance to stay at the Inn at the Market. We have stayed at several hotels in Seattle over the past 9 years and the Inn, by far, is the best. Best location, best service (and this is quite an achievement considering all the fine smaller hotels in Seattle), friendliest staff, beautiful, and quiet rooms, and dining that is superb. We booked a water view room and were upgraded to a deluxe water view room. It was fantastic. We dined at Cafe Campagne and it reminded us of many small, but excellent, restarurants that we have enjoyed in Paris. The food was excellent and our server, Courtney, was a gem. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: beshfu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in to room types during our visit. We got a deal for a water view suite. This suite was very, very roomy! The main floor was the living room and small kitchenette with tv. The upstairs was the bedroom and bathroom with another tv. The view was amazing!! It was very clean and very comfortable. My only slightly negative comments would be lack of lighting in the bedroom. Since it was so large, the few lamps at either end of the room did not provide enough light for the middle of the room where the closet was. Also when I stay in luxury hotels, I do expect the bathroom to be way above standard - this one was large, but not with much useful space. There were no drawers/shelves to put toiletries. Also the water pressure was so low. Although there was a nice size tub, it would have taken forever to use it. Plus the shower head had little pressure and was not adjustable so rinsing my long hair took a good amount of time. For the last part of our stay we stayed in a smaller room with a city view. It was really nice - clean comfortable and very well lit. Also the bathroom had shelving to put toiletries and the shower head was adjustable so it felt like more water pressure due to its setting. The hotel overall was magnificent - it’s customer service was everything I’d expect from it’s ratings. Also it location was great. I’d definitely recommend this hotel. While the view from the water suite was outstanding, I’d probably only book it again with a great deal because the smaller room was really nice and I liked it’s bathroom better.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful oasis in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Barbara K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for a weekend in the middle of September. Even though the hotel is in the front of the famous Pike Market, it is very peaceful and quiet. Our double bed ocean view room on the fifth floor was comfortable, very clean and generous in size. All employees at the hotel are very friendly, helpful and caring. The hotel has a small cute courtyard and a rooftop terrace with amazing ocean and city views. The location is a perfect base for exploring the old and new Seattle. We love everything about the Inn and will definitely come back !

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: bharris123
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Inn at the Market before and decided to return there due to the attitude of the personnel. Even the man painting the hallway thanked us for staying there! This time we requested a water view and we were not disappointed. The room was very roomy and comfortable. This hotel is ideally located for those visiting downtown Seattle. It is within walking distance of great restaurants and wonderful shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: NorthumberlandTopCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IATM twice on our recent holiday to the USA, on arrival & on our last night. We arrived at the hotel much earlier than check in time but this wasn't an issue, although our room wasn't quite ready, the receptionist took our mobile number & promised to call us as soon as the room became available, the concierge took care of our luggage and that left us free to stretch our legs, explore and grab a coffee after enduring a 10 hour flight to Seattle. We were in our city view room within the hour & were not disappointed, clean, bright, spacious & wonderful comfy king size bed. After a couple of hours rest, we popped out & bought a bottle of wine and sat enjoying the uninterrupted views of Elliott Bay from the terrace (this is such a bonus). At the end of the evening we returned to our room and housekeeping had replaced the towels, turned down our bed and left us a couple of chocolates, this was a lovely gesture. When we returned to the hotel for our last night we had chosen a room with water view, given that the terrace is available to enjoy the water view, we felt this was an over indulgence, as the room itself (apart from the view) offered nothing more than the city view room, just we payed an extra $76 dollars for the priviledge. All the staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them, if we returned to Seattle we'd certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendliest employees, great service!!”
Reviews.Author: AVIDEATER
Reviews.Content: I booked reservations at this hotel because of the responses of manager, David Watkins. I thought someone who cared that much to respond to every trip advisor comment, truly cared about his hotel. He does! This comes across through every single employee, from the second you arrive at the hotel. Everybody employee comes across as happy. Happy to be there, happy to be of assistance, happy to recommend great places for dinner. The rooms were beautiful with fantastic views. The beds are tough to get out of! High quality bedding was wonderful and almost worth spending all day in. My only con...low flow shower. Great for the environment (not for a good shower!) Regardless, I will chose this hotel for my stay, every time I come to Seattle!! Well done, David!!!! Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences...”
Reviews.Author: 2005highlander
Reviews.Content: This was a special trip so we booked a "water view" King room. Fabulous!! Floor to ceiling windows that opened onto a view of Pike Place Market below and Elliott Bay beyond. The room was large with plenty of storage space and comfortable furniture. And the bed is the most luxurious I've ever slept in--helped, of course, by high-quality bedding and fluffy comforter. Every single staff person we interacted with was friendly and helpful. I had occasion to talk to 2 young men during our stay and they both said that they were proud to work for the hotel because of its fine reputation and quality. That says a lot about a place and about the management. If you're considering a stay at this hotel I encourage you to look at the website.
