It's impossible to beat being able to walk out the front door and head to the Market to grab some Daily Doughnuts or Three Sisters bakery for breakfast before the crowds get unbearable. It's the perfect home base for most anything you want to do. We walked everywhere--Safeco Field for Mariners game, ferry terminal for Bainbridge Island ferry, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Grady_Dugan66
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning from a cruse, and were just looking to drop off our luggage at about 10am (check in is at 4pm.) . The staff was great they were able to get us into a room. The room was spacious and plush. We were able to walk to everything we wanted to see. This hotel is typically out of my price range, but I would splurge again if I find myself in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Inn and Personnel exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: cherylwithaC
Reviews.Content: After a ll day land/cruise tour to Alaska, the Inn at the Market in Seattle was a perfect end to a wonderful vacation. My friend and I were so pleased we chose the Inn. Walking distance to the Market and waterfront, wonderful suggestions from the front desk as to which tours to take, where to eat, etc. Our only regret is we only could stay two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Georgia7L
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until we departed, we were charmed by every aspect of this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is an easy walk to Pike's Market, the Seattle Aquarium, the warf, shopping, and great restaurants. My husband and I had the two room suit, 'casual elegance' would be the best description of the room. It had wonderful views. We had room service for breakfast, it was excellent food. We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else when we come to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Best View in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: DateNightGirl
Reviews.Content: The service is phoenominal, very accomodating, professional, friendly and efficient without feeling pretentious. I highly reccommend the water view rooms, even as Seattle natives we were wowed by the view. The rooms are modern yet cozy and the bathroom is spacious and well appointed. Don't miss out on this Seattle gem.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: magpie016
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at the Market one night before leaving on a cruise to Alaska. We arrived early in the morning. Our room was not ready yet but the hotel staff took our cell phone number and called us when it was ready. The desk staff was very helpful and gave us directions to the Space Needle. I somehow pushed the wrong button on my camera and got it into the wrong mode. I had forgotten to bring the manual with me. When we got back to the hotel I asked at the desk if there was a camera store near by. The girl at the desk asked what the problem was. When I told her she offered to try to find the manual on the internet for me. She downloaded the instruction manual for me and showed me what I had done to get my camera in the wrong mode. The room we had was very nice. It had a partial waterview and we could look out on Pike's Market from our room. We were able to walk through the market in the morning when it was still fairly quiet before we left on our cruise. The room was quite large and very comfortable. I would definitely stay here if we ever come back to Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: JJS3
Reviews.Content: If you go to Seattle, you have to spend time around the Market and there are not many places closer to the market. It is a bit pricey, but the service is great, the views are amazing and the atmosphere could not be better. We spent three nights there and got up early each morning to wander around the area. Our room was of great size and faced the water. Get up early and walk the half block down to the market and watch and smell it come alive. Try the Russian porosky (probably not spelling it right) or any of the other wonderful pastry shops along the Market. There is a great coffee shop down First Avenue next to the Four Seasons - or try the first Starbucks located across from the Market. For dinner walk over across the street to 94 Stewart - amazing food and great wine. Pass on the ghost tour, but try the food tours. I was pulled along for the choclate tour and had a blast. Bottom Line: The perfect place to take in the Market area. Be prepared to pay for the location and service, but both were worth it.

Reviews.Title: “This is a beautiful hotel with amazing views and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: cagirl11
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Market Inn and loved it!! We had wine and appitizers on the 5th floor deck over looking the water and Pikes Market Place. We walked every where we needed to go. Loved it and will return when in the area! Lewes, De

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view, clean and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Baseball_Tripping
Reviews.Content: We live less than 20 miles from Seattle. It is great to enjoy our beautiful city like a tourist. The view from our room was spectacular. We watched the sun set over Elliott Bay and the Olympic mountains. The staff is very friendly. There are plenty of restaurants and bars to go to within blocks. And of course the Pike Place Market is right below.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Irishgirl21N
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the inn for a work trip, and it was a wonderful experience! My room was very spacious, including the bathroom. It was nicely decorated, comfortable chairs, a nice desk area, nice sized tv, and comfy bed. I had a great breakfast at Bacco and enjoyed the complimentary tea in the lobby. The free business center came in handy, thank you! The service was wonderful! Everyone was very nice and helpful in directing me around Seattle. The inn is steps away from the Public Market and some fabulous restaurants. My only complaint would be the lack of a beverage area on the rooftop deck, which provided stunning views of Puget Sound. If I ever return to Seattle, I will definitely stay at the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!! Location and value”
Reviews.Author: Mrjphotos
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on he Inn at the Market I had high expectations and the hotel and staff lived up to those expectations. The location is great for the market, great restaurants and other sights. Looking for a great breakfast try the crumpet shop and dinner and drinks at the virginia inn down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ebbie1
Reviews.Content: Excellent little hotel right next to the very interesting Farmer's Market and the original Starbucks! Very well located and very quiet with polite and helpful staff. Within walking distance of important Seattle landmarks

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: jus4jam
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Staff was very attentive and cordial and the room was very upscale but very comfortable. Would stay there again, and again, and again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: NZB
Reviews.Content: I think our bags were nearly in our room before we could get out of the cab. The service was very good, despite the slightly eerie feeling when they welcomed us with our names off the luggage tags. We stayed in a city side room, which was quite comfortable. For those who are light sleepers or not used to city noise, I would highly recommend booking a room on one of the other sides of the building. We were fine with our 3 hour jet lag. The hotel is steps from Pike Place market and surrounded by good places to eat (try the crumpet shop for breakfast). Don't miss the spiced tea in the lobby, it is excellent after a walk in the rain.

Reviews.Title: “We have travelling USA for six weeks and found The Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: climax46
Reviews.Content: The Inn at The Market has it all , great position ( at the market ) great views , market one side city the other and a small and very comfortable hotel in which to stay . Staff were very accomodating and friendly from initial reception to departures over the two visits we made to Seattle whilst cruising . Rooms were large and generously furnished and the beds , wow !!!!!!! , large bath tubs !. We were upgraded to a suite with a large patio and despite cold winds we enjoyed the pleasure of space and the sea views . Thanks to all the staff for our wonderful stay and will return .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindacook
Reviews.Content: The location, the hotel and the staff were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional location and service”
Reviews.Author: luv2r0am
Reviews.Content: It's not often we visit a hotel with high expectations, and yet have our expectations exceeded. The Inn at the Market is that kind of place. We traveled to Seattle via Amtrak, so arrived in the city well before check-in time. While the Inn staff were careful to warn that they could not guarantee early check-in (and we did not expect it), our room was ready for us when we arrived almost 6 hours before the 4 PM check-in time. We reserved a city view room and were upgraded to a room with a window seat overlooking the market and the water. After visiting the market, we returned to find a bottle of wine and welcome note from the Inn staff waiting for us. All staff, from bellhops to front desk staff were unfailingly friendly, exceptionally helpful, and each willingly shared favorite places to visit while in Seattle. The manager, David Watkins, has been at the Inn for 16 months. Disregard any reviews prior to his arrival- he's very "hands on" and runs an extremely well managed operation.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: cclgbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Inn on a recent trip to Seattle. The locations was perfect. We could walk to everywhere we wanted to go (even the car rental place when we were leaving). I worried about the market noise, but even though we were right on Pine St., it was quiet at night and morning until about 9 AM. There are several breakfast/bakeries to get breakfast at and great coffee in the market - so easy to get to fast. We opted for a city view room (at a lot less cost) because the Inn has a fabulous deck overlooking the sound for its customers. Since we were never in the room except to sleep, why pay for a view. From our bay window, we looked right out at the Market sign, but all is quiet once it closes. One night after dinner elsewhere, we just wanted a dessert wine with the chocolates we had bought to eat on the deck. The bartender at the hotel restaurant, Campagne, walked us across the courtyard, then handed us the drinks (in compliance with liquor laws) so we could take them to the deck upstairs. I wish we could have tried both hotel restaurants but we were there only for seafood and they are French. Just a great and convenient place to stay in Seattle - go to the market before the crowds and have a waterfront deck for lounging.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: littlemom25
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to everything good. Very nice hotel with a wonderful restaurant in the front courtyard. Staff is friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed the roof top view. We would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Seattle location”
Reviews.Author: lsilveria
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotels.com as a city view room, but we were pleasantly surprised that we had a partial ocean view. We arrived 3 hours before check-in time, but we were able to get a room immediately through the very friendly reception clerk. All the employees from the valet to the people planting new flowers in the corridor planters gave us a very warm hello as we walked to our room. The room was very clean, homey and spacious. If you are coming for a special occasion, I would highly recommend the ocean view rooms. This hotel is smack dab in the middle of all the action at Pike Place Market, so forget about your car and just walk and take in the atmosphere and the boisterous vendors passing out samples of fresh pears and nuts. (We when arrived at the room, my husband opened the window and soft sounds, including someone playing piano, could be heard from the market below). It is also an easy walk to the Seattle Space Needle and restaurants. This hotel also has a big spacious deck that we took advantage of when the skies cleared and the sun came out for two days! I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Seattle because of the price, location and employees. I'm hoping my husband will take me back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle Location”
Reviews.Author: sparksjan
Reviews.Content: Great place, perfect location and access to all for the best of Seattle. Such a pretty place, very nich terrace with such a beautiful view of Elliot Bay and Pikes Martket and the staff was wonderful. Clean & comfortable room. We will stay there again when we visit Seattle in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This is a truly wonderful place to stay, centrally located and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: rsa117bday
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and nicely decorated. We had a king bed, with a temperpedic mattress,which was wonderful.The bathroom was large and clean also nicely decorated. We had a court side room which was a bit quieter than the street side. The weather was beautiful and we wanted to open the window but when we did the exhaust from the restaurant was very unpleasant. That was our only negative issue with this wonderful place. The staff were knowledgeable, friendly and always helpful. The location is across the street from the Public Market, and an easy walk to shopping and bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful management & staff”
Reviews.Author: dimsumNE1
Reviews.Content: So much has been written about the ideal location...ideal! Beginning with the valet, to the bellman, to the front desk, management, housekeeping to the driver service, we were given friendly and efficient servcie. Thank you! We had stayed one night at the Inn, took off for Oracs for 5 days and returned to the Inn. When we returned we found our room had been upgraded and a bottle of wine and a handwritten note was waiting for us..thanking us for returning and for filling out the survey a few nights back. Completely unexpected and we enjoyed our waterfront room! Brunch at Campagne was most memorable. The cookies and hot spiced tea/coffee in the lobby was a nice extra too. Only suggestion: change the small bed pillows to full size pillows :) And the AC was a bit loud so we just turnd it off in the cool evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, accomodating and gracious”
Reviews.Author: tyeung612
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a prime downtown location. The staff from the bellman to concierge, to front desk and even housekeeping are gracious and pleasant. I don't believe they know what the word "no" means because everything we requested was delivered as promised and then some. While the beds and pillows could use some work because they were not the most comfortable, the staff made this hotel stand out as one of the best that I've been to. I'm used to my five star hotels but Inn at the Market by far exceeeded my expectations. I would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay. Next to Pikes...”
Reviews.Author: Wlkrblk
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. Next to Pikes Market. Superb service. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Seattle Experience”
Reviews.Author: Roxemgirl
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel truly made us feel like we were at the heart of Seattle. I could literally run across the street in the morning and get pastries or fruit at the market to bring back to the room. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: P21932
Reviews.Content: Great Staff, friendly and professional. Wonderful restaurants bith at the hotel (Campagn is great!) as well as nearby. We had several great meals at local recommended restaurants. Room was spacious including the bathroom. Valet car service was prompt and professional. Location is superb. Steps away from Pike's Market and only a few blocks from the Art museum. 5th floor deck area with great views of the bay. We got the last room available in the hotel for one of the nights we stayed, so water view was not available, but we will choose it next time, it would be especially nice for a romantic getaway! My favorite hotel (of many) in Seattle, a town with several good hotels to choose from. My new #1...why stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary Getaway”
Reviews.Author: triciajp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Inn at the Market for our second wedding anniversary. The staff was extremely helpful, the rooms were great, and you cannot beat the location. Inn at the Market was exactly what we were looking for. We will certainly be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: crimsontraveler
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Market is in a prime location, my husband and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon! We sat at our table and delighted in watching the city life outside our window as well as a spectacular view of the ocean!! We walked to the Public market and had breakfast with the best view in town and not to mention fantastic eggs with smoked salmon!!! You can walk to so many places yet feel cocooned in the great little secluded nook the hotel sits in. Wonderful service, yummy chocolates left every night, even brought us up a dictionary for one of our scrabble games, talk about service!! Wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: viajeramx1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with excellent location, just steps from Pike Market and the coast. The only thing I didnt like was the restaurant for breakfast, its too small.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: GraysHarbor
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel and can hardly wait to return. The location is fantastic... just steps away from the famous Pike Place Market, but also very close to everything else. Some may find walking the steep streets of Seattle a challenge, and for those people there are taxis, buses, and a monorail, but we enjoyed hiking all over. The views from our room were impressive. The hotel staff were helpful and in good spirits. The room was very clean and spacious. They don't really mention it anywhere, but our room had a very comfortable tempurpedic mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: i_m_tours
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in this hotel having booked it for our city break to Seattle after having read the good reviews on Tripadvisor. The reviews hardly did the hotel justice which was just about perfect in every way. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean, the view from the hotel deck over the Puget Sound was just breathtaking and the staff could not have been of more help. However the best bit about the hotel was its location "in the Market". It was ideally placed for Pike Place Market, shopping, various other attractions and a whole host of excellent restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again if we ever return to Seattle

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful gem in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: SpikeVancouver
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of hotels in Seattle but this was one of the best experiences. It is a delightful little boutique hotel - we were comped to a fabulous water view king room - incredible views and a really pretty room. Wonderful location right above Pike Street Market and within easy walking distance of all the great shopping in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Staff will go above and beyond your expectations”
Reviews.Author: ARTSeattle
Reviews.Content: We originally stayed at the Inn for our Honeymoon and decided to go back for our 7 year anniversary. The staff was amazing and went above and beyond to make us feel special for our celebration. Thank You so much The Inn and The Market. We will be back again soon. P.S. Get a waterview room it is worth it the view over the Market and Elliott Bay is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations... we will definitley be back !”
Reviews.Author: jleeearley
Reviews.Content: We were planning a one night getaway for our 5 year wedding anniversary. We were driving up from Portland, OR. We wanted something downtown Seattle, close to the water.... nice but something that wouldnt break the bank. I looked up "Best hotels in Seattle" and Inn at the Market was one of them. I looked at several but this one definitley caught my eye. I couldnt have been more pleased when we pulled up. The valet service was great, quick and the guys were friendly and helpful. We checked in and mentioned to the front desk gal that we were celebrating our anniversary. She upgraded us from a city view room to a water view room, and put us on the top floor, The view was incredible. Next time we stay here we will request the same room, it was perfect. We could see the Pike Place sign from our room, and the ferrys crossing ! The room was very comfortable... especially the King bed. I havent slept that good in a long time. The front desk was very helpful with directions and suggestions. We came back from dinner to find a card from the staff saying Happy Anniversary and a bottle of Pike Place wine. What a great experience. Be prepared to pay $25 or valet parking, which is a little steep, but they do take good care of you.... fast and friendly. Next time we will eat at Champagne, the restaraunt downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “UNBEATABLE VIEW AND CONCIERGE”
Reviews.Author: reighden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights here on our honeymoon. We could not have been more pleased. The view is simply amazing in the waterfront rooms and from the rooftop deck. Our bed was made of memory foam. We even tried the mattress test with the glass of wine and jumping on the bed. It worked! So comfortable we are thinking about getting one for our home. The concierge were so nice and extrememly helpful. Noelle especially. We booked the inroom massages as well and were very happy with them too. I can not recommend this hotel enough. We will never stay anywhere else in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: frances447
Reviews.Content: A reallly friendly and comfortable hotel in an excellent position.Lovely spacious room with views across the bay.Very comfortable bed and excellent breakfast service

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay price”
Reviews.Author: acmorris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here for one night. If you have only one night in Seattle and you want an awesome location so that you can maximize your time here, this is the best choice. They also have a very nice rooftop patio which has a fairly amazing (and often private) view of the bay. The room is quite good - clean, good mattresses and what you'd expect from a decent hotel. I should note that the rooms on the street side are probably a bit noiser than the ocean view rooms (due to the folks wandering the street at night), but we still had a great time. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: october-road
Reviews.Content: Wow. Before booking this hotel, I read so many reviews on Tripadvisor, and I am so glad that I chose to stay here. The views from our room, the location and the service could not have been better. There is also a fabulous rooftop deck that overlooks the Market. The room was large, very clean, and elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, superb location.”
Reviews.Author: deviant1966
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Seattle Airport and chose to be met by the hotels town car service and were pleased to see the driver waiting for us right outside the terminal building, no fuss, no waiting. He told us all about the buildings and areas we were driving past on the way to the Inn at the Market, this took around 20 minuets. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by the bell boy who very kindly took our heavy bags from the boot of the car to reception as soon as we pulled up. At reception it was smiles all round as we were given room 606, water view. Well worth the small extra charge. Front desk, in particular Noelle, were fantastic. Excellent local knowledge and helpful tips on eats and drinks. Lots and lots to do and see within walking distance. On the doorstep of Pike Market. We researched this place fully before booking and can truly say it is excellent. We had a hold up booking at our end because of the British Airways threatened strike action and communication between us and the hotel via email was superb, they were understanding, helpful and eased the stress and worries of our travel plans by holding our beautiful room without further question. We loved our short stay at Inn at the Market, would recommend it and also be staying with them again. On a final note, thank you Noelle and Eric!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Truly Special Location”
Reviews.Author: LandisD
Reviews.Content: In mid February my wife and I had the opportunity to stay at the Inn at the Market before we headed up to the Olympics in Vancouver. First all I have to say that you cannot beat the location of this hotel. Being only a very short walk to Pike's Market is awesome. We loved walking around the area, visiting the shops and eating at all the different locations. Lucky for us it was absolutely beautiful weather the three nights we were there. The room was wonderful and the bathroom was nice and large. The Ipod speakers were a nice touch and we liked getting the Seattle Times every morning. The small chocolates every night were a sweet treat. The staff was always very friendly and helpful in suggesting restaurants and talking about the area. The best part of the hotel is the (almost) rooftop terrace that looks out across the sound. On a nice day it was wonderful to have an escape with a wonderful view. My complaints of the hotel are few, but in general I would say that the basic rooms are overpriced for what you receive. I would recommend paying just a bit extra to get a room on the courtyard or have a sound view, because the street that we had a view of was less than desirable. Also, I'm glad that we got to try a Tempurpedic bed before purchasing one, because neither of us was a big fan. One other thing that would be a very cool touch in my opinion would be to have a hot tub up on the terrace. Just a suggestion of course. In all reality I would like to give this hotel a 4.5/5, but those very few complaints kept me from giving it the full 5. I could easily recommend this hotel to anybody looking for an oasis in the heart of downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, fabulous staff and personal touches”
Reviews.Author: tacomatravelista
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on a whim to get away overnight for an anniversary celebration. Rate was a last-minute rate, and seemed very reasonable for a boutique hotel. So we went for it and were so pleased! Staff upgraded our room to celebrate our anniversary, provided a chocolate treat and a happy anniversary note which made us feel very special. I forgot my Blackberry charger at home and the staff even had a spare charger which helped make my life much easier. The rooms were clean and well-appointed, and felt very spacious. Woke to a lovely view of the water and market. The BEST location in Seattle in my opinion, if you are playing tourist during your stay. Campagne for brunch was HEAVENLY and literally steps from the front door. $25 fee for in-and-out privileges/valet parking might seem a bit pricey, but parking is hard to come by in that area! Can't find anything to complain about with this hotel, and will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: BostonBostonmass
Reviews.Content: The view was spectacular; what a treat to wake up to the Olympics and Puget Sound, with the ferries going off to Bremerton and Vashon. Even Mount Rainier was out! We felt immediately welcomed and cared for, and spent two restful nights at the Inn at the Market during our Seattle visit. I've already recommended this hotel to several friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: CapBoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. A fairly expensive room but worth every penny. Staff was unbelievably helpful when asked about restaurants and things to do in the area. The room was sparkling clean and the room service and maid service was outstanding. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Seattle if I had enough money.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Kamuke
Reviews.Content: If you're ever in Seattle, you can't go past Inn At The Market. Ideally located next to the historic and vibrant Pike Place Market and within easy walking distance to the centre of the city, it's a beautiful boutique hotel. I stayed there with my brother for four nights and the staff couldn't have been friendlier or more efficient. I had a large package delivered to the hotel, which they kindly held for me, and they provided me with a free razor after I realised I'd forgotten mine. Our room was spotless and comfortable. Great value for money all-round.

Reviews.Title: “delightful small boutique hotel perfectly located for foodies or anyone looking for a romantic intimate setting”
Reviews.Author: NWfoodie50
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival in the a.m. well prior to check in times, we were greeted by the valet who was pleasant and efficient. We left our car and bags with him , so that we could spend our day walking downtown and enjoying a fabulous lunch at Maximillans overlooking the Sound in Pike's place market. As parking in this area is a challenge, the valet convenience is something to take advantage. We enjoyed dinner at the hotel's more casual french cafe, Cafe Campagne, as the more formal Campagne is closed Mondays. We were very pleased with the service and our meal, both were in a relaxed french cafe tradition. After dinner we enjoyed a view of the city lights from the 5th floor balcony of the hotel...which is open only to guests. If it was a warmer night it would have been a perfect place for a glass of wine after dinner.

Reviews.Title: “always nice”
Reviews.Author: cambridgeBostonMA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and it's been a good experience. It is a little pricey but worth it. On my latest stay they upgraded me to a townhouse suite which was luxurious. There were two flat screen TVs, wine glasses, and dinnerware in the suite. Wonderful views, comfortable rooms, a deck facing the market and the bay. The staff have always been helpful. Nothing at all bad to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “A splurge, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: coloradoteam
Reviews.Content: Actually finding the hotel is hard, but when you're finally there, it 's beautiful. I contacted the manager before the trip and said I was surprising my husband with a trip for his 40th birthday. He quickly moved us to a waterview room at no extra charge. It was breathtaking! He had mini cupcakes waiting in the room with a note saying "happy birthday and enjoy your stay" to us! We only stayed for one night, but everything was great. It's literally right over the Pike Place Market toward to ocean, then the other direction is all of the shopping and eating you could dream of! A great area!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better than this hotel”
Reviews.Author: educ8tor
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for my birthday last March. It was our very first trip to Seattle and we wanted a hotel that was close to everything. Boy, this hotel was IT! From the moment we arrived, we were greeting by the finest staff imaginable. Check in was smooth, informative and friendly. We arrived to our room to find that not only did it have beautiful views, there were little cupcakes and a handwritten card waiting for me as a birthday treat! This hotel was darling, absolutley perfect in every way. The rooms were clean and well kept, the staff was amazing and the location was unbelievably prefect! I am a kindergarten teacher with very little time off, but the next time I have a free weekend, this will be the place I come. It's been almost a year since we've been and we can't stop talking about it! Thank you to everyone for making my birthday so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATLgirl50
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. The location is definitely ideal, but was not impressed with the overall quality of the rooms. We paid $250 a night for waterfront (which we got and was beautiful) and $350 for NYE night. For the price I would have thought the room would have been a little nicer, ie the armoire, tv, art on the walls, and thicker pillows on the bed. The walls in our bathroom were dirty with black scuff marks. Also, our heat blew cooler air for some reason and we only actually felt heat maybe once an hour. The staff was nice and the valets were excellent. I wasn't expecting 5 star, but just nicer finishes overall for the money. I am not a high maintenance traveler, but will spend my money elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Still good, but not as good as it was”
Reviews.Author: WandererOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: In the past, there were freshly baked cookies in the lobby, but those seem to have disappeared. When we wanted to have some wine in our room, we found that there was only one wineglass and one empty paper mat where the other should have been, a situation that persisted for a couple of nights. We got stuck in a room with a shower but no bath, despite having previously indicated to management that we take evening baths. And it's surprising that a hotel in this category still doesn't have flat screen televisions. These are obviously very small points, but given Seattle's abundance of good hotels, it doesn't take much to tip the balance in favour of another place. That said, the location of this one can't be beat, and its two restaurants - Campagne and Cafe Campagne - are fantastic..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MillersSeattle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a few days off from the family and stayed at the Inn at the Market. We enjoyed our stay. The service was good but sometimes a off. But overall we had a nice stay. It is a splurge for us but if you can get a discount, its even better. Can't beat the location. Good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fairy tale beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: beachbumbrandi
Reviews.Content: Imagine the courtyard of your most beautiful fairytale, this is what you will see when you arrive at Inn at the Market. White lights, fountains and beautiful benches adorn the exterior courtyard as you wisk your way through the circular door into the firelit lobby with smiling staff greating you. The staff were so pleasant and even though my daughter called them many times a day from the phone in the bathroom ( because she thought that was " so cool") they still complimented her on her outfits and hats every time we went through the lobby, even offering fresh baked cookies and cupcakes. The room was beautiful with nice linens and an amazing view. Being an original building to downtown and the Market, you might think it outdated but not so. They have kept the charm but updated the furniture and finishings in high class. The rooftop patio is something not to be missed. Even though we were there in the winter, we took our hot drinks and wore our complementary robes up to the rooftop to watch the ferries drift across the water all lit up. People watching and hearing the sounds of the city at night were so fun. When the chill got to us we continued the fun in our room with the floor to ceiling windows that opened to the railing and city below. The night we wanted to go to dinner the Inn's towncar and driver happily drove us and came back to pick us up, free of charge! Gratuities are welcomed and please tip well as these kids are so kind and work very hard to be gracious. Overall this was a perfect stay, within the same block as the Market and the Original Starbucks And a French bakery that is soooo yummy. Enjoy the best view in the city and in my opinion, the best staff. We will definately be back in the summer to take part in the rooftop BBQ's and a glass of local wine.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful birthday at the Inn at the Market”
Reviews.Author: gastronome80
Reviews.Content: To celebrate a recent special occasion, I decided to treat myself to a pampering stay at our neighbor, the Inn at the Market. The day of my reservation, December 1st, turned out to be a beautiful Seattle winter day. There was hardly a cloud in the sky as I pulled up to the valet stand for the Inn, several hours early for my check-in time. I was planning to have lunch nearby with my mother before checking in and didn’t want to bother with finding street parking before I could have my car parked in the hotel lot. John, the valet, was happy to take my car for me. The front desk was incredibly accommodating as well, allowing me to check in early and letting me upgrade into a better room. Since I had never stayed in the hotel before, I had no real idea what to expect, aside from some of the pleasant looking pictures on their website. I received my room key and headed upstairs. (As a note, there was always an elevator open and waiting for me every time I entered the lobby!) I opened the door to a nice, spacious room. It was clean and bright and brightly lit by the afternoon sunlight despite all the curtains being drawn. I was in a bit of a hurry to meet my mother for lunch down the street, so I set my belongings down and went to head out the door. Before I left, I thought to myself, “I can’t really leave without taking a glance at the view, can I?” I walked back across the room to pull the curtains aside and involuntarily gasped. The view was stunning and was coupled with a private patio that was almost as large as the room itself! Now, those who know me are familiar with my great love for Seattle and both its natural and man-made beauty. To be on that patio, standing over Elliott Bay with the embracing cityscape of the Emerald city surrounding me, was invigorating. After a moment of appreciation, I turned back into the room and noticed out of the corner of my eye four delicate cupcakes and hand-written card acknowledging my special occasion. An excellent touch. After lunch, some friends joined me in the room for some sparkling wine and conversation for a couple hours before dinner (dining out is my favorite way to celebrate). The hotel was quick to provide some extra glasses for our festivities and brought them up nearly in the time it took to open the bottle! The night was wonderful. It was so pleasant to wake up in their luxurious bed to another clear winter day beaming in through the windows and through the patio doors. A couple very relaxing hours of lazing around and I called down to the front desk to alert them that I would soon be ready for my car (as they had asked). After returning my keys I walked out the lobby of the hotel to see my car already waiting for me. Soon after returning home I realized that I had misplaced couple items. When I came back to the restaurant the next day I stopped by to inquire with the front desk if I had left them there. Sure enough, they had them set aside to return to me. All in all, I couldn’t have asked for a better downtown Seattle experience to celebrate.

Reviews.Title: “A+++ in Every Aspect”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTravelFiend
Reviews.Content: The block walking distance to Pike Place Market and top-notch restaurants made this an ideal location for my grandmother in which she could return to our room whenever she tired. Views of the market and Elliott Bay from our room and the rooftop deck couldn't have been better. The front desk and bellhop staff tended to every need imaginable. Certainly worth a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “WOW. A hidden gem....”
Reviews.Author: KatieL322
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing and you won't be sorry if you stay here. Right in the heart of downtown and 1/2 block north of Pike's Market. You don't even really need a car if you stay here. There is a restaurant across the street called Steelhead Diner that has the BEST CRAB CAKES ever. The hotel is in a small quaint building that doesn't look like the other high rise hotels in Downtown Seattle. It has Tempur Pedics beds and the real kicker is the 5th floor rooftop terrace that overlooks the market and the Puget Sound. The desk staff was nice enough to give me a great room with a partial water view (even though I paid for the inexpensive city view). Each night I would take a bottle of wine and cheese and sit on the terrace and watch the ferries roll in on the Puget Sound. This hotel is what MADE my stay in Seattle so great - that and the Lady Gaga concert at the Showbox! The desk staff at the hotel were so friendly and I really felt at home while staying there. I had never been to Seattle and was alone for a week long trip- the staff did everything possible to ensure I had a wonderful trip. They pointed me to all the great shopping places nearby, local restaurants or coffee shops I might like to try and even gave me some pointers on diff neighborhoods in the city. The bellman and valet were also super helpful and friendly. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel and the staff who work there- I felt so welcomed! 5 stars for this place! Inn at the Market should know they have free advertising in Tucson, AZ from me! I'm going back in April and will be staying there again. Cannot wait!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Location - Above Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cruzca
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Seattle for a fun weekend and stayed at the Inn at the Market. We booked our room via an Alaska Airlines Vacation Package. The package deal provided a free night (equating to a nearly $300 savings). The key elements of this hotel are the location and staff. The rooms are fine (not remarkable) but they are plenty clean and comfortable. We highly recommend staying here via a package deal to save some money. LOCATION: The hotel's location is tough to beat. It is literally right across the street from Pike Place Market and the original Starbucks. It is within a short walk to key Seattle downtown sites (Space Needle, Pioneer Square) and in our case we didn't have a car. Valet parking at the hotel runs about $30 a day. ROOMS: Our room had a partial view of the water (which really added a lot to the experience and reduced noise compared to the city-only view rooms). They were pretty new and felt clean but did not exude luxury. The bed utilized a foam-based mattress (but was comfortable) and the sitting area was small but nice. Overall the room was the least memorable aspect of the stay but clearly not a reason to not book at this hotel. SERVICES: This hotel has an exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. From the moment we arrived (they set us up with an early check-in), to great food suggestions and a kind valet service we felt like service was king here. They provide a free choice of newspapers delivered to your room (Seattle Times, NY Times or WSJ), the hotel has a free shoe-shine service and they provided taxis and other needs without hesitation. The restaurant (which is connected but not affiliated) was good for breakfast but a bit expensive - it ran $40/couple. If you are willing to walk a little there are bagel shops and other food opportunities at reduced rates in the area. The wireless Internet was reliable and fast/free. OVERALL: Overall we would stay here again. We found rates to be a bit high through their website but would attempt to stay via a package deal. We would highly suggest attempting to obtain a view room (water view) and possibly eating at non-affiliated restaurants to save money. If you want a weekend location where you can walk to everything, have a clean and comfortable room with outstanding service this hotel will work well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great room, wonderful service, amazing view”
Reviews.Author: tuffy0317
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Seattle for four days to celebrate our second wedding anniversary. Neither one of us had been there before, so we were looking for a fun place to play tourist and explore a new city. The hotel was in a great location, literally half a block from the famous "Public Market" sign at Pike Place Market. The location makes it so easy to walk over to the Market for breakfast in the morning and is really a great home base for all your touring. Our room was fantastic. We paid for a city view and had a room on the sixth floor, facing Stewart Street. However, because the window bumps out a bit like a bay window, we were easily able to see out onto Elliot Bay. One of the highlights of our trip was sitting in the little bump out window, sipping local wine, watching an amazing sunset. Our room was quite large - we both were surprised at the ample seating area (sofa, coffee table and chair) and the large bathroom. The free wifi was great also. The hotel has a nice "roof top" deck, which unfortunately it was too cold for us to really use when we were there. I could definitely see having breakfast up there during nicer weather though. The lobby is also nice, and we spent some time reading the paper by a nice fireplace while we were waiting to go to the airport. If you don't have a car, the towncar service to go to and from the airport was a good deal and made the trip a little extra special. My only complaint, and it's so minor, was that the front desk staff was not very helpful in suggesting "off the beaten path" things to do. We had covered the whole downtown area pretty well by our last day and wanted to venture into one of the surrounding neighborhoods (Capitol Hill, Queen Anne, etc.) The man at the front desk had no suggestions on where to go and gave us wrong directions to Capitol Hill, which was a bummer way to end our trip. Overall, a great experience though. We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: roberae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at the Market for the first few nights of our honeymoon. The staff knew that it was our honeymoon and when we got in there was a little fudge cake and the nicest note waiting on us in the room! The flight left us frazzled and it was above and beyond of them to give us a little treat. What a perfect way to start a honeymoon! The location was also great! We tried to save a little money by not getting a water view room and that worked out perfectly because of the guest balcony that we used everyday. The balcony of the hotel looks over the Puget Sound and the market. You can even see Rainier and the Olympic Mountains in the distance. Our favorite part of our trip was cuddling up with a bottle of wine and fresh fruit from the market and watching the sunset. The location was great, the staff was nice and the rooms were clean. You would have to have outrageous expectations to not fall in love with this hotel. I would recommend it to anyone staying in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but overrated”
Reviews.Author: paoztraveler
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on TripAdvisor, our expectations were high. After staying for 3 nights, we felt the hotel was definitely overrated. Location is good, view on roof is fantastic (the great weather helped). Rooms are okay (though we requested a room away from the street noise and did not get it). Valet staff went above and beyond. However, we did experience issues with Maid Service and Concierge. Several times the maid knocked once then barged into the room (early in the morning, no less). On two occasions we phoned the Concierge service for restaurant advice, they said they would phone back and never did. In the spirit of a boutique hotel, they did not have evening/late night dining or room service. I would recommend to friends, but with some caveats.

Reviews.Title: “A suprisingly nice boutique hotel with a great location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Traveldog86
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel were very nice - large and modern with a comfortable bed (although the bathroom needed a better shower and more counter space). The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was very convenient for fisrt-time visitors (across the street from the Pike St. Market and near many good restaurants and shops). The hotel terrace was GREAT...a wonderful place to sit with a bottle of wine and a book and spend an afternoon relaxing or watching the sun set!! For people that like the smaller, one-of-a-kind hotels in large cities...this is a very good choice!

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved our stay at Inn at the Market!”
Reviews.Author: SeasideJenni
Reviews.Content: After reading many, many reviews on this website, I contacted the manager directly to see if he could assist me in making plans for a short 2 night stay in Seattle for our wedding anniversary. He promptly responded with an offer that I couldn't pass up! This past weekend my husband and I stayed at the Inn in one of the town house city view suites. The hotel & staff were amazing! We absolutely loved this hotel and will for sure be back in the future! I have already told many friends and family that next time they're in Seattle, this is "the" place to stay! When we first arrived, there was an anniversary card and a special dessert for two waiting in our room! It was delicious and such a nice gesture! Typically we would go out for a nice anniversary dinner where ever we happen to be. At the Inn, there was a set of dishes for two in our room, so both nights we decided to get takeout and bring it back. Fixed up our plates and headed to the deck on the 5th floor. Amazing view and plenty of space! Even though there were other guests out there, everyone had their own space and it was wonderful! The room was very spacious and super clean! Two big flat screen tv's... bay windows that look out on two different streets, one with partial market/water view. The location couldn't be more ideal! Steps from Pike Place Market which is always one of our favs when in town for a visit. Thank you Mr. Watkins & thank you to your staff! We really enjoyed our stay at your hotel and can't wait to come back! This was definitely an anniversary to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but”
Reviews.Author: whisperingpalms
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days a couple of weeks ago and found the service to be very prompt, the bed comfortable and room clean. The location was great but I was harassed one night by a persistant homeless man looking for a handout, while walking near the market after dark. When I did some internet research I learned that Seattle has lax laws toward panhandling, and that the panhandling is sometimes "aggressive". I also learned that that some of Seattle's services for the homeless are located in the market area. That being known, we avoided walking back through that area in the evenings and were were not harassed again there. This has nothing to do with the hotel but I think it's important to let people know to exercise caution in the market place after dark, especially since the hotel is adjacent to the Pike Market. We thought the rooftop outdoor sitting area would have benefitted by a fireplace or at least a few heat lamps.

Reviews.Title: “When I tell friends of GREAT places I've visited, this hotel tops my list”
Reviews.Author: TraverseTheUniverse
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Service? Great! Rooms? Amazing! Location? Can't beat it. Right across the street is the Pike Place Market (which overlooks the bay), full of fresh flowers, vegetables, and art cultivated by locals. Haggled for an fantastic glass-blown vase and got a great deal. Walking distance to many restaurants, though admittedly, they do close a little early. If you get room service, try the fresh squeeze orange juice. When I asked at the front desk for recommendations on where to go/what to do, the lady cheerfully gave me a map and gave me a few points of interest; she even outlined the free public transportation routes for me! Then, when it was time to go, the valet retrieved my car quickly and with pep, even at 4 in the morning, and he offered me tips on the safest places to get gas on the way back. They really take care of their patrons. If I ever go back to Seattle, this is definitely where I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant place for a short Seattle visit”
Reviews.Author: oilguy57
Reviews.Content: I'm mystified by the couple of terrible reviews. The staff at Inn at the Market was very professional with us and the accomodations were very nice. I had booked a Town House City-View Suite for my wife and I as the last stop on a 10-day trip. We both were impressed with the spaciousness of the room(s) and quality of the little touches. Huge flat-csreen TV's upstairs and downstairs, small safe in the room, quiet even with the large windows facing the city streets. The 5th floor deck is wonderful, it would be even nicer if there was more space (impossible) and if the hotel would prohibit smoking (possible). The hotel itself is non-smoking and Seattle is a healthy city. C'mon management...go all the way and make the rooftop no-smoking too! Easy access to Pike Place Market, the first Starbucks and not that far from Safeco and Qwest Fields...great location. We also had them arrange for a town car to SEA and it was ontime and had us at the airport less than 30 minutes later. Granted, it was not a "bargain", but you can't expect Fairmont style for La Quinta prices! All in all, we very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: travelingangler
Reviews.Content: The best location possible, in my opinion. Right on the marketplace. a short walk to the waterfront and the ferry terminal. Restaurants are close by and the bus system downtown is free! You just can't beat the location. The staff was attentive and professional and he room was spotless with a bed that was fantastic. I would recommend the Inn to any one traveling to Seattle for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and cozy with view”
Reviews.Author: bumpkin13
Reviews.Content: Super location in Pike Street Market. Fabulous views of harbor and market. Watch the vendors set up the market or the action in the harbor. You are in the heart of Seattle. What you can't walk to, you can ride the free city bus. Clean, beautiful rooms. Get your coffee at the original Starbucks, your french pastry at Le Panier and then head to the patio on the 5th floor for breakfast! Or sip a glass of wine in the evening from the patio as you watch the sun set over the harbor. Great place for a romantic escape.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great view, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: wundrwomynn
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the Inn at the Market but the location was perfect. It was easy to walk down to the Pike Place Market to grab breakfast or something to eat. The rooftop deck was spacious with a great view of the market and water. The front desk was friendly and helpful. We had a city view room which had a large bay window but it was quiet. The room was spacious with a sitting area and large armoire with TV as well as a side table by the door with a fridge, coffee maker and pay snacks. The bathroom was great - large, with a floating glass shelf above the sink for storage as well as another table against the wall with more space and a large shower. Overall, it was a great stay in a top notch hotel in the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “great location, beautiful inn!”
Reviews.Author: suehhi
Reviews.Content: This was a nicely decorated and well kept inn! The room was comfortable, especially the bed. We really loved the rooftop terrace. It was a great place to relax as we overlooked the market and the bay! The location of the inn was it's best feature! Right at Pikes Market! (Although we thought that the market wasn't as nice as we expected!) We didn't venture out after dark, though, as there seemed to be lots of sketchy characters around!! During the day we enjoyed walking everywhere, from the market to the downtown shopping areas! We enjoyed all the choices of food alongside the market...especially Beechers cheese store's macaroni and cheese!!!!!! Try It!!!! It's WONDERFUL!! In all it was a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.......perfect place from which to explore Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: ricardo16
Reviews.Content: We had only three days in Seattle......and this was the perfect location. Pike Market is literally out the front door with all of its shops and restaurants. The busy market crowd is high energy and colorful making it a great place to just hangout during the day. At night everything is closed up and cleared out so you can simply enjoy the views and peacefulness of the Sound. There are plenty of great restaurants within a few blocks, many with views of the water or city. From the hotel the waterfront views are amazing and the patio on the fifth floor was a great place to retreat at sunset with a bottle of wine and sandwich. You can watch the boat traffic and ferries shuttling out and back from the the islands. The ferry docks are are less than a 10 minute walk. 10 minutes the opposite direction and you can board the Monorail out to the Seattle Center and Space Needle. Or simply walk 10 blocks to the historic district. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. The rooms were exceptionally clean and nicely appointed. I'm not sure what could have made our stay any more enjoyable.Can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out suite, lackluster service - saved only by location”
Reviews.Author: csmac
Reviews.Content: I'm baffled by the number of 5-star reviews for the inn, though I notice recent lower scores scattered amongst the somewhat similar gushing reviews. Hmm. We booked a Townhouse Suite with views onto Elliott Bay, intending to stay for a week. On the second day, we'd moved downtown to the Alexis on 1st and Madison. To start with the positives: if your room faces the bay, you will enjoy some of the finest views the city has to offer. The location right next to the market is a major bonus. And now the bad. To say the suite was tired would be to heap praise where it isn't due. Appallingly noisy and asthmatic air conditioning; elderly furniture; curtains that were out of date 10 years ago; mismatched lamps, several of which had no bulbs; opening the window one was faced with an extractor belching out fumes from a nearby restaurant. At check-in, the female member of staff was neither welcoming nor professional - she dropped the check-in process halfway through to answer a phone, with our keys eventually being provided by an overly casually dressed woman who wandered in from elsewhere. At check out, there was none of the usual "did you enjoy your stay?" inquiry. Seattle has much better to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Revy93
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best places I've stayed. It was near everything we wanted to do. It was really close to the Market, I'm guessing that is where it gets its name. It was close to the water. It was close to a lot of toursist attractions. It was darn near next to the tattoo place I chose to go to for my permanent reminder of a temporary feeling. The people there were very knowlegeable about places to go, where to eat, and just about anything you asked. I will stay there again when we do visit again. We had a room that had two window seats, one towards the front of the hotel and one on the side. From the side you could see the water and the ferry boats always going back and forth, plus you could see all the people shuffleing ( sp ) by which for me is an extra bonus as I am a people watcher. I like to sit in one place and watch things go on. The whole town is a very dog frinedly town, everyone we crossed paths with were very nice. I am apparently a person that attracts coversation because I had several local people come up to be and we just talked. So much to say just can't remember all of it at this point. I haven't been this exciteed about a place since I was in San Francisco at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View... Terrible, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: HockeyGDS
Reviews.Content: For our anniversary and my first trip to Seattle, my husband chose the Inn at the Market for our stay due to the high reviews, its location and the services they provide. Although Expedia booked us for a city view room, my husband sent a message to the hotel and told them he was willing to pay for an upgrade to a water view room. We never received a response from the hotel despite that fact that he sent the request for an upgrade two and a half months in advance. Finally my husband contacted them a couple of weeks before our trip and they informed us that they had just booked every room. The town car service is a joke. The first time we used it, the driver (who is also the bell hop) didn’t know where the museum was, despite the fact that we had the address and its major cross streets. After driving around the block once, he told us that he needed to get back to the hotel and that maybe we would have better luck finding it on foot. So he dropped us off in the “ghetto” (he literally dropped us off at the door of a homeless shelter with people loitering, smoking marijuana and talking to themselves). We had no idea where we were or where we needed to be going and we totally stood out. Luckily someone was able to point us in the right direction. The driver had dropped us off about four blocks away from where we asked to go. Had I been that driver I would have at least called the hotel and asked if they could have provided me with directions, not dropped the tourist off in a highly questionable neighborhood telling them that typically the bums don’t cause people trouble during the day as a reassurance! Our second experience with the town car was even worse. We had a dinner reservation at the Space Needle for our anniversary and when we inquired about using the town car, we were told that due to the Sea Fair Torch parade and traffic being difficult to navigate that they couldn't be bothered with the town car. (As tourist, one of the times you need a courtesy car the most is when traffic and typical routes are difficult to navigate due to a special event!) At this point we asked what they recommended we do and they suggested a cab or the monorail. We thought maybe the hotel company had a specific cab company they used, but no, they just hail whatever cab happens to be driving by and because the streets were closing down for the parade not a lot of cabs were going by. We ended up taking the monorail which is about five or six blocks away from the hotel. On our walk back to the hotel after dinner we had the pleasure of walking by a “suspected” gang shooting as it took place (two blocks away from the hotel). We were walking when we heard seven gunshots and suddenly we were surrounded by suspected gang members and police officers with guns and TAZERS drawn. Checking the Seattle Times, we were relieved to learn that only one person was wounded and no one had died, but it obviously wasn’t the end to our anniversary night that we had hoped for. With the amount of money we were paying for the room (not to mention the $25 a day to “valet” the car), I really expected superior service. The view was the best part and it was only "nice", it wasn’t worth all the money we were paying. Either they have really poor customer service standards or they treated us poorly because we booked through Expedia, either way I will not recommend that hotel to anyone. It just wasn’t worth the money in the long run. To be honest the whole experience really tarnished what otherwise was a wonderful anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “We wanted something special to start our trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Batman251
Reviews.Content: For years we had wanted to travel to Alaska, We had a stopover in Seattle and wanted to stay somewhere special. After reading reviews of hotels we decided that Inn at the Market was the place to start "our trip of a lifetime" and we were not disapointed. The rooms were beautiful and staff extremely friendly. relaxing on the rooftop in the evening watching the sunset was really something special. We will stay there again and tell all our friends about this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with lots of charm.”
Reviews.Author: pampered11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for two nights after a cruise. This hotel is very, very close to the Public Market. We had a city view room, which on the fourth floor you dont have a great view. There were some rooms that were water view, they had a sliding glass door that looked out over the Market and the Puget Sound. The staff were all very personable and all spoke English clearly. They were very eager to please the guests. Something to remember is they have a car that if they are not busy, they will transport you to a restaurant or sight around town. Would most definitley stay there again. Oh, and make sure you make it to the rooftop deck.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as other reviews say”
Reviews.Author: ljfbos
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the Inn at the Market with my spouse and teenage son. I had reserved a waterview room, and needed a rollaway bed for my son. Room was nice, but 3rd floor view of water included the roof of the next door building (not picturesque). We inquired if a larger room might be available, and were told that all rooms were the same size. Therefore I'm confused as to other reviews which discuss "huge" rooms. Location is wonderful, but room and staff were not at all as impressive. As one other reviewer mentioned awhile back, the water pressure in shower is awful, the tub is tiny so that a shower always involved the curtain sticking to me, our sink drained so slowly it was rather unpleasant to look at! Also, the air conditioner is very noisy when it goes on/off during the night, often waking us up. The queen bed was comfortable, but awfully squeaky. I'm not usually one to complain, but I feel that I had to add this review to counter all the wonderful ones I read before booking this hotel. Staff was nice enough, but not at all helpful - in fact, the only restaurant that was ever recommended to us was Cutters down the street - we wondered if they were getting paid to do this! (Cutters is ok, but nothing to rave about). When I asked for another casual restaurant for salads/sandwiches, one young man at the desk even said there weren't restaurants like that in Seattle.... something I find hard to believe. Everyone on staff seemed more like college kids in summer jobs, not professionals who know the city. Sorry to burst any bubbles, but other than the location near the market, this hotel is not one I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: mambogirl
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Inn at the Market was a delightful culmination of much planning by my partner and Noelle, a concierge at the hotel. When we arrived, our room had been upgraded to a 7th floor water view room (a birthday surprise from my partner) that overlooked the deck on the fifth floor. The room was spacious and quiet with a sliding glass window that actually opened! We were able to enjoy the sounds of the city and the cool breezes or shut the door and enjoy the quiet. The view was always beautiful. The hotel staff's attention to detail and impeccable service only added to our enjoyment. Noelle had put together a delightful surprise of fresh flowers from the Market and a wine and cheese basket and cupcakes and chocolates that I am still enjoying!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ChicoStateMom
Reviews.Content: Our room wasn't quite ready at check in, they held our luggage after suggesting we could have another room, but the concierge recommended we wait for the one we'd been assigned. Good call! We had a corner room on the 8th floor with an unbelievable view of the bay. Service was outstanding, location perfect. What a splurge. If you can, you should definitely stay at the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection with smiles”
Reviews.Author: TxgalSpringTX
Reviews.Content: We spent one night before a cruise and three afterwards. The first night was upgraded to waterview. Noelle Donahue, amazing concierge, engineered some complicated planning with me to celebrate my partner's birthday: wine, flowers, a picnic basket with hand picked and perfect goodies and a gorgeous waterviw room on the 7th floor. she obtained last minute reservations at 94 Stewart (go!). The deck was a great spot to watch the market and the water. The staff was cheerful, helpful with directions and advice and everyone made our stay perfect. Oh, and Bacco serves great juice and breakfasts. Thank you everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: javsigx101
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights - wow! The location of this place is unbeatable, just steps down the hill to Pike Place Market and some of Seattle's best restaurants, i.e. Matt's at the market, 94 Stewart and the Steelhead Diner - all were superb. The Inn at the Market has some of the friendliest staff I have ever met, my room on the eight floor was spacious, huge bathroom and came with a commanding view of Puget Sound. There is a deck on the fifth floor - very nice - spent time there as all four days I was there were sunny. This is more of a larger boutique style hotel with a great atmosphere. I don't think you could pick a nicer hotel in all of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “No better place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Maydreamscometrue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first two nights of our honeymoon before our cruise at this hotel. From the minute we were picked up at the airport to the moment we left the staff was incredible. Always super friendly and helpful. When we checked in they saw we were on our honeymoon and upgraded us to a waterview room at no charge. They also left us a handwritten note and piece of delicious cake in our room. The rooms and bathrooms are both large. The beds are Tempurpedic beds so we got the best nights sleep.This hotel is in a perfect location you are steps from Pikes Market. You are also within walking distance to tons of shops and restaurants. We were deciding between a couple of hotels and we were both so glad that we decided on the Inn at the Market!

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it,DO IT!!”
Reviews.Author: traveleasy1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights for our 10th anniversary.A couple co-workers who grew up in Seattle suggested we stay here if we could afford it.It is pricey but WELL worth it!! The service and location can not be beat.We were exhausted when we arrived and we were a little early for check in.The front desk said they saw it was our anniversary and asked if we could wait a short time so we could get an upgraded room. I REALLy wanted to lay down and shower but my husband encouraged me to go down to the market and wait. When we walked down just a very short distance the Pike Place Market just perked me up. The flowers and food were fantastic. We bought a huge bouquet of hydrangeas{my all time favorite} plus sweetpeas and the hotel called to say our room was ready.We only had to wait maybe 30-40 minutes. The room is nothing really special but the view and the roof top deck along with the location were fantastic! We had a queen size tempurpedic bed which was small but comfy. Lots of closet space, a small table and chairs to look out at the street,market and water. We were on the 5th floor and kept the windows open all day but did close them at night since the action and traffic continues all night,but it was very quiet when the windows were closed. There is GREAT shopping and restaurants EVERYWHERE around the hotel!!! We had lots of different things planned for our 4 days but really just walked around near the hotel and had a great time. We had great weather and loved going up and down 1st ave and Pine,Belltown and Pioneer Sq. are just short walks. The service was fantastic,everyone had great smiles,suggestions and really seemed to like the guests and their jobs. They got me a couple vases and scissors in 2 minutes after check-in so I could enjoy my flowers for the whole visit.We loved Cafe Campaigne for happy hour and Brunch,Matt's for lunch,don't miss Macrina Bakery for ANYTHING! We had Pike Place Fish pack a big box of fish and produce to bring home on the plane,They're the best!

Reviews.Title: “What a Jem”
Reviews.Author: BadgerTim
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on all the positive reviews that people have gave this hotel on TripAdvisor. This is a small hotel with stylish rooms and spectacular views. Pulled up to Valet and before I even had a chance to get out of the car we had to bellmen unloading my car. The customer service was outstanding and I would recommend this to anyone traveling to Seattle. One drawback and it is not the hotel fault. A lot of the restaurant close early due Pikes Market closing. The few that are open are busy with long waits. The long waits might have been caused by UofW graduation but next time we will plan out where we are going to eat dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, friendly staff, weak on water pressure”
Reviews.Author: anniep1977
Reviews.Content: The Inn was a warm and welcoming place. The location is fabulous. We had a beautiful room with a partial water view. The only problem we had was that there was very little water pressure in the shower. We had to call the front desk to send someone up to check. By the time the maintenance man arrived and remarked that the water restricter was on the shower head and needed to be replaced, it was time for us to go to dinner. We didn't get to shower and the front desk staff didn't seem bothered by the inconvience of the situation. Very strange. I guess they already knew the restricter would make showering a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “this place is awesome”
Reviews.Author: stevelevy99
Reviews.Content: I was curious from all the listings and VERY happy that I picked the Inn. The location is fantastic down the street from Pike Place and the original Starbucks, many shops and restaurants to choose. The staff are extremely friendly and professional. They upgraded my room to water view and were very attentive. The high speed is included and works, but does kick you off from time to time. Watch out at night by the market as there are lots of homeless people hanging around.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more”
Reviews.Author: rjsnau
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel out of any hotel we have ever stayed in! The staff is wonderful, the location is perfect and the rooms are well maintained and perfect. They are literally steps from Pikes Place Market. What more could you ask for!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rescued me three times in one visit !!!”
Reviews.Author: Green-Eyed-Tx-Lady
Reviews.Content: Just today I wrote the manager of this hotel to specifically thank and name several employees for their help. Here's why: 1) my vacation plans fell apart due to the volcano in Alaska and I was fortunate to get the last room at The INN....I was tired and feeling bad and stuck at the airport and the front desk clerk said I could even check in early. 2) On the 2nd night I was feeling worse and having my 22 yr old son with me I needed to find something that did not require much energy or participation on my part for us to do. The front desk staff helped me get last minute tickets to a Beyonce concert. 3) By the 3rd day I could not stand the pain. I had been taking pain medication for an abscessed tooth but now I needed an emergency root canal or get the tooth pulled...the infection had spread and even my eye was swollen. Not only did staff members find me a top notch endodontist in less than 10 minutes but they managed to make me an appt for that afternoon! Even though I was leaving that day they allowed me to check out late and go straight from the hotel to the dentist. Before I left a caring maintenance man who came to the room to adjust the heat ( I was to sick to do it ) noticed how bad I felt and brought me a special pot and lots of tea. Together the the staff saved me from further pain and I did not have to have my tooth pulled. I recommend this hotel because of its location but I HIGHLY recommend it because when situations don't turn out as you expect and you need help you are in good hands with its SUPER service oriented staff.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: PhillyVoyager
Reviews.Content: Inn at the Market has become our go to place when visiting in Seattle. Because of conference housing requirements we've had to stay at other hotels on other visits and have always missed being at the Inn. The major pluses are the 1) incredible courtesy and helpfulness of the staff 2) the location so close to the Public Market and 3) the general ambiance of relaxed elegance. Typically Pacific Northwest in its decor, the best feature is the rooftop deck that overlooks Elliot Bay. From there, you can sip wine, watch the sunset and the ferries coming in. We stayed at the Inn as "bookends" on our trip to the San Juan Islands and were lucky enough to be upgraded in room type on both ends of our journey. The free wireless worked well and the self-serve business center had a computer to use to print out boarding passes for our flight.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: bsaunders
Reviews.Content: On this, out first trip to Seattle, I can genuinely say that we found an hotel which we would have no hesitation in recommending to anyone. In fact, my wife and I, who have traveled extensively, would rate the Inn at the Market as being amongst the top ten hotels that we have ever stayed in. The service was pleasant but not obtrusive, our room contained everything we could have desired, the bed was wonderful and any information needed was at hand and easily understood. I also liked the the vista of the harbour and surrounds, when relaxing on the hotel's open terraced area on the fifth floor. A free computer facility was open to us as well, so emails could be checked and the Internet visited. Being only yards away from Seattle's famous Pike Street Market was a bonus and the variety of restaurants in a general cosmopolitan area was an added attraction. We only spent a couple of nights at Seattle, at the end of a three week USA visit, but we could see that Seattle has a lot to offer. If we only had more time.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a wonderful hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aikin
Reviews.Content: If at all possible, stay at this wonderful hotel!!!! What an unbelievable place!!! I am a travel agent & just returned from 3 nights at The Inn At The Market. David Watkins, you are a truly remarkable manager. Your hotel stands out, miles above the rest. You have trained your staff very well. They all seem to enjoy their jobs & truly care about the clients. Kudos to all!!!!!!! The room was spotless & well decorated, bathroom is a dream bathroom, view -spectacular, bed very comfortable, chocolates - delicious. I could go on & on, but everyone should experience this themselves. I will sell this property to any clients coming to Seattle. And of course, I plan on returning within the year. Thank you again to everyone at the Inn At The Market!!! You made our Seattle trip the best!!!!
